Job_Title: Senior Product Manager / Marketing Manager, IC, ASEAN
Job_Descriptions: At Boston Scientific, well give you the opportunity to harness all thats within you by working in teams of diverse and high-performing employees, tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With access to the latest tools, information and training, well help you in advancing your skills and career. Here, youll be supported in progressing whatever your ambitions. Purpose statement The successful candidate will be responsible for the formulation and execution of marketing and market development strategies to identify and drive BSC Interventional Cardiology core portfolio to leadership in the ASEAN region. The role will require deep insights into customers' needs and the competitive landscape, assessing new market opportunities, and developing a suitable strategic response to maximize opportunities in the country/sub-region. In addition, this role will collaborate with regional marketing teams to develop country/region-specific messaging and positioning, and when required, will provide launch support, including training of in-country sales and physician education. Intent is to capture and broaden BSCs market share in existing and potential markets as well as being accountable for achievement of sales goals. Key responsibilities Marketing Strategy Planning Drive the strategic planning efforts for own franchise across relevant countries in the region through mapping the market, identifying potential gaps and exploiting new opportunities in line with franchise strategy and global guidelines to drive growth of own franchise Business Planning (AOP) Develop/support Annual Operating Plans and lead execution of AOP (budgets/ resources/ activities etc.) for own franchise across relevant countries in the region Market (Market Conditions, Customers, Competitors) Analysis Lead execution of market analysis activities (Market research, identification of new opportunities, therapies, technology advancement competitors etc.) for own franchise to generate insights and support development of marketing strategies. Evaluate digital touchpoints to ensure optimum insight generation. Marketing Operations Initiate and lead the design and implementation of marketing programs in the region, develop networks and establish advisory boards; ensure alignment of own activities with International functions (Finance, Supply Chain, Health Economics, Marketing, Clinical, Regulatory, Quality), establish strategic vendor relationships and periodically review effectiveness of marketing operations across own franchise in the region Product Life Cycle Management Lead and monitor the rationalization of the stent portfolio; oversee coordination with operations team to manage the supply chain for products, review monthly forecasts, backorders & plan inventory transitions for new products, track portfolio performance and ensure accurate and timely reporting across the region for own franchise Marketing Communications Drive and monitor execution of BSC Branding/ marketing communications in the franchise across the region; provide inputs for brand messaging; guide impactful tools and innovative approaches such as Pitcher; monitor and evaluate impact in line with the Global communication guidelines to ensure appropriate brand positioning for own products. Ensure product training and competitive messaging aircover to support field sales force. Stakeholder Relationship Management Establish and develop relationships with key stakeholders/ KOLs/ economic buyers and influencers as relevant to own domain; participate in conferences/ symposiums, guide program design in order to develop advocates to communicate key company messages to the medical community; network with counterparts in BSC global to drive regional objectives Sales Enablement Liaise with regional & in country sales leadership for own franchise to align sales and marketing objectives; drive sales team capability with DigiX and map needs assessment and guide programs for capability building on products and clinical messaging; align with global to identify marketing collateral and disseminate them in country to ensure achievement of franchise marketing objectives and sales support as required Quality Ensure awareness and compliance with applicable standard operating procedures to meet, comply and champion all quality and regulatory commitments of Boston Scientific; As interface to Customer and Sales Organization has direct responsibility to facilitate, share documents and process to identify, notify and ensure any complaint or problem are addressed, thereby demonstrating high commitment to Quality in all interactions and behaviors; Responsible to facilitate and champion the quality requirements and the message of compliance to internal and external customers for all events and campaigns. Quality System Requirements In all actions, demonstrates a primary commitment to patient safety and product quality by maintaining compliance to the Quality Policy and all other documented quality processes and procedures. For those individuals that supervise others, the following statements are applicable Assures that appropriate resources (personnel, tools, etc.) are maintained in order to assure Quality System compliance and adherence to the BSC Quality Policy. Establishes and promotes a work environment that supports the Quality Policy and Quality System. Qualifications and experiences Minimum undergraduate degree from a reputable university. Candidates with MBAs will be preferred. Prior knowledge of coronary anatomy and cardiac functions, with understanding of as industry and market segmentation, therapy, physician mindset and competitive solutions. Track record of Product Marketing with strategic planning & execution with strong stakeholder management, providing varied offering to different market segments Good communication skill and high degree of cultural awareness sought to operate in virtual settings. Proven track record of successful project management and execution of multi-tasks in a fast-paced demanding environment, with ability to work well in a collaborative environment Frequent travel of up to 50 PERCENT required once the borders are open. Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Demonstrates strong willingness to invest in self for growth and possess leadership potential

Job Description Qualifications/Requirements Provide architecture and best practices guidance in building secure products. Review product architectures for security design gaps and vulnerabilities and consult with product teams to remediate or mitigate cyber risk. Support product security process activities including threat modeling, security requirements, security reviews, threat vulnerability assessments. Lead efforts with the development teams to quantify residual product risk and identification of appropriate security controls. Provide product security related coaching/mentoring and security expertise. Provide secure best practices to development teams to achieve 62443 product level certifications. Responsible for setting the direction for security, both vulnerability remediation and features across the assigned portfolio. Ensure adherence to security standards and provide guidance and input to standards enhancements. Participate in standards and research opportunities outside of RA. Maintain current knowledge of security threats and vulnerabilities that could impact products. Drive timely and effective resolution of vulnerability reports in support of PSIRT Understanding TPM, Secure Boot, OTP, PKI, SPI/I2C bus analyzers, JTAG probing. Preferred Qualifications Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering Minimum requires 10 years of experience with demonstrated professional development in software or embedded software design and development, including minimum 3 years of technical leadership in design/architecture. Industrial cybersecurity and/or information technology knowledge with subsequent certifications (CSSLP, CISSP, CCSP, OSCP, CEH or related cybersecurity certifications). Experience working with development teams to review design, conduct threat models and secure coding practices. Understanding of security by design principles and architecture level security concepts. Active participation in hackathons, cybersecurity competitions, and exercises are a plus. Understanding of security standards and frameworks; ISA/IEC 62443, NIST CSF, NIST 800-82, NERC CIP, and others. This is a summary of the positions responsibilities and does not reflect the entire scope of work expectations.

Job_Title: Site Inspector, Mechanical Electrical and Controls Automation
Job_Descriptions: Site Inspector, Mechanical Electrical and Controls Automation - ( ASI0002HU ) Your Impact At Jacobs, were helping our clients innovate and grow by designing, engineering, and executing the construction of their various facilities that are changing our world. Our talented experts create exceptional spaces across the world through our creative blending of human need, environmental stewardship, value creation, science and art. We believe that built environments should reflect the context, history, cultures, communities, and the natural environment while incorporating advances in technology. Our Water business would like to welcome you to be part of an Advanced Meter Infrastructure (AMI) project as a Site Inspector. You will be part of an exciting water meter digitalization project across Singapore. This Site Inspector role will inspect the installation, testing, commissioning and monitoring of Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) Smart meters as part of the AMI Demonstration Project. The Inspector should have an interest in water metering systems, plumbing system with local regulatory requirement, and wireless communication, M&E installation for smart meters, as well as IT skills. The Inspector role includes oversight and supervision of meters across Singapore. Weekly reports on the data and statistics will be required with OMNI Software tools and reporting to Site Engineers, Functional and Project Managers. Work under the supervision of a Site Engineers (SE), Project Manager and the Implementation Manager. Responsible for standing supervision of the installation works and verification of the AMI meter performance against an agreed set of criteria with the client. Essential duties Initial oversight of configuration and successful installation and commissioning of AMI meters distributed across Singapore. Ongoing oversight and documentation of results including communication signal strength, signal quality, alarms, noise and alerts. Verify meter data through Meter Data Management System (MDMS) and correctness of data to the Electronic Billing System (EBS). Oversee Contractors installation against contract specifications and requirements. Prepare reports, alert the client and Jacobs of any pending issues, and make recommendations on the projects success. Inspectors to support the SEs in the direct monitoring of the AMI contractor and they shall be present in Singapore for the duration of the assignment. Each Inspector shall carry out preferably same day quality supervision and assurance site checks on 100 PERCENT of the meter installation/replacement works performed by the AMI contractor and report deficiencies to the SEs. Each Inspector shall validate newly installed hardware information (such as meter serial numbers and meter readings) preferably electronically as well as perform an assessment of the as-left site condition, any irregularities (such as leaking valves) as well as rectification works by AMI contractor. Here's What You'll Need To be a successful candidate you shall possess Minimum Diploma in Mechanical / Electrical / Instrumentation Control and Automation or equivalent from a recognized University or other acceptable qualification from reputed institutes for multiple positions. Minimum 3 years of relevant working experience in overseeing/supervising site/field works or construction management. Experience with similar smart metering installation with smart water meters is preferred Familiar with local regulatory requirements A Singaporean working right

Job_Descriptions: Our culture of innovation began with the invention of the Field Programmable Gate Array (FPGA), and with the 2018 introduction of our Adaptive Compute Acceleration Platform (ACAP), has made a quantum leap in capability, solidifying our role as the adaptable platform supplier of choice. From the beginning, we have always believed in providing inventors with products and platforms that are infinitely adaptable. From self-driving cars, to world-record genome processing, to AI and big data, to the world's first 5G networks, we empower the world's builders and visionaries whose ideas solve every day problems and improve people's lives. If you are PASSIONATE, ADAPTABLE, and INNOVATIVE, Xilinx is the right place for you! At Xilinx, we care deeply about creating significant development experiences while building a strong sense of belonging and connection. We champion an environment of empowered learning, wellness, community engagement, and recognition, so you can focus on work that matters - world class technology that improves the way we live and work. We are ONEXILINX. The product Characterization team is looking for a highly motivated individual to evaluate the performance of Xilinx ACAP products. As a member of the product characterization team, you will develop and execute system-level characterization tests to guarantee design margins and ensure the functionality of various IP including ARM processor, Memory controller (DDR4/LPDDR4 etc), PCIe Gen5 and Ethernet. Responsibilities include but are not limited to Co-Developing system-level tests for evaluating SOC performance at the application level Implement volume system characterization, analyze test results to discover trends and outliers Work with cross functional team to investigate and find solutions to various issues, including developing manufacturing tests for the coverage gap Generates automation flow and scripts where applicable for efficiency improvements Collecting and analyzing characterization data across operating conditions and volume to generate characterization reports and insights Requirements - Bachelor/Master Degree in Electrical/Electronic Engineering, 5 or more years of experience - Experience on IO characterization (Analog and Mixed Signal), and knowledge on various IOs standards (LPDDR, DDR, LVDS, MIPI, LVCMOS) - Bench equipment knowledge, e.g. signal generator, oscilloscope

Posted by: Jacylnn Tan Onsite Recruitment Lead View profile & contact 2022 Operations Trainee Academy Programme - Singapore Company Overview We're a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future. We have around 5,000 people on six continents. And we've been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn't change is our commitment to helping our clients, and society, prosper. We're committed to investing sustainably and integrate Environment, Social and Corporate Governance (ESG) into our decision-making across all investments whilst maintaining long term performance for our clients. We can back this up with our impact measurement tool which combines measures of harm and good effect of companies to provide the overall social and environmental impact. Our Operations Team We support our global business by providing high quality and efficient operational oversight, processing and reporting across all of our business channels. Operations covers a broad spectrum of responsibilities from ensuring confirmation and settlement of trade activity, daily oversight of the funds Net Asset Value (NAV) to ensuring that we meet all of our Client, Fund and regulatory reporting obligations. It's a busy and dynamic area with many exciting opportunities to build and develop your career. The Base In Singapore, Schroders' presence dates back to the mid-1970s. Since then, we have successfully built a strong local franchise and are one of the largest asset management companies in Singapore today. We manage funds for a broad range of clients including official institutions, sovereign wealth funds, insurance companies, charities, government-linked companies, high net worth individuals and retail investors. Singapore is our Asia Pacific operations hub, providing operational oversight to other offices in the region such as Australia, Indonesia, Hong Kong and Japan. The team constantly seeks to develop and adopt innovative and collaborative solutions to bring the best results for our clients. The Programme You will join as a permanent employee and start your career in the Operations Academy before moving into a dedicated team.  Over the two-year programme, you will be rotated across a number of areas to give you an introduction into operations.  You will also have the opportunity to network and meet with the wider business groups, which will give you insight into the world of asset management. We want you to be innovative and creative in your approach in understanding what we do and how we do it. We will provide training throughout the two-year programme which will cover: aspects of the asset management industry via accredited learning to gain the Level 3 - Investment Operations Certificate; functional knowledge through a regular rotation into different teams; application training as part of the on-the-job experience; as well as non-functional training, such as organisation skills and written/verbal communication effectiveness, to help broaden your overall skills set. You will learn from experienced colleagues as they guide you through the various applications and processes which will allow you perform your role more efficiently. The knowledge, experience, and qualifications • Demonstrates strong communication skills and working well within a team environment. • Experience of prioritising workload, demonstrating a keen eye for detail, problem solving and confidence in communicating escalations when required. • Show great interpersonal and analytical skills. We will teach what you need to know about the job. We just need you to bring your drive, passion and enthusiasm to make the most of the opportunity. The candidate we are looking for We take pride in hiring the right people for our programmes. People who can hit the ground running and want to make a difference. • We look for people who are naturally curious about the world around them and who are eager to learn more about our industry and what we do. • We want someone who is not afraid to bring new ideas to the table • You are someone who is flexible and able to think independently, be proactive and an advocate for change • A team player with strong communication and collaboration skills are essential as you will work as part of a team to overcome challenges and share ideas. • A growth mindset: we understand you may make mistakes, and when you do, we are looking for you to learn from these • We want you to contribute to our continuously evolving culture, whether it's participating in our recreational clubs and campaigns or starting your own. Recruitment process 1.    Online application form and CV 2.    Online assessments 3.    Online video interview 4.    Assessment centre 5.    Final round interview Applications will close approximately 2-3 weeks before the assessment centre, but please note that we recruit on a rolling basis so we would recommend that you apply early.

Job_Title: Vice President - Corporate Banking Business Oversight Compliance
Job_Descriptions: Vice President - Corporate Banking Business Oversight Compliance Vice President - Corporate Banking Business Oversight Compliance Singapore As a Barclays Vice President - Corporate Banking Business Oversight Compliance you will build confidence in our bank for today and for the future of finance. You will oversee the day-to-day Business Oversight Compliance (BOC) for the Corporate Banking businesses across APAC including: Singapore, Hong Kong and Japan. We are looking to grow the role where you also have the chance to collaborate closely with other members of the Private Side & Research Compliance team, in APAC, to assist with BOC coverage for Singapore's Private Bank and Investment Banking and Research businesses. Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity - helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted. What will you be doing? You will initially be responsible for BOC compliance matters such as conduct risk and reputational risk for APAC Corporate Banking in Singapore, Hong Kong and Japan, Working with management and Ops Rigour teams to check and challenge embedment of controls by relevant policies and procedures to meet regulatory requirements Highlighting areas of concern relating to APAC Corporate Banking's embedment of the Enterprise Risk Management Framework in relation to conduct risk and reputational risk Delivering the conduct risk agenda and relevant training to the business Checking and challenging APAC Corporate Banking's risk assessments in relation to conduct risk and reputational risk Working with the Cross Border Compliance team to advise on regional cross border issues Working with relevant Country Compliance teams to advise the business on regulatory changes (alongside relevant Country Compliance) Assisting BOC for Singapore Private Bank, APAC Investment Banking and APAC Research What we're looking for: Carrying out duties in full compliance with regulatory requirements, Enterprise Wide Risk Management Framework and internal Barclays' policies and policy standards. University degree or equivalent industry experience Senior stakeholder management with all senior leadership across various countries across APAC Proven expertise and knowledge of Corporate Banking Compliance matters, analysing structured transactions and ensuring identify and investigate compliance issues Skills that will help you in the role: Experience in the legal or compliance departments of an international investment bank or large organisations Understands complex transactions and explains compliance issues clearly and concisely Ability to become familiar with new products and regulatory requirements Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritise and multi-task Where will you be working? Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a "city in a garden". Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you're just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.

Job_Descriptions: Vice President, Employee Experience Business Strategist, Transformation Group - ( WD28563 ) Business Function Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the Worlds Best Digital Bank (Euromoney, 2016 & 2018) and Best Bank in the World (Euromoney 2019). Develops and implements business analyses, facilitating and execute human-cantered design processes across multiple projects Utilize insightful data and analysis to create actions which support or challenge business decisions Proactively identify opportunities for process improvements and develop action plans and quantitative feedback to improve employee experience Drive scientific rigor and discipline into how DBS creates employee experiences through scientific and experimental approaches Evangelist to help connect People Analytics with business outcomes. ie. facilitate workshops and trainings that build employee experience awareness and capabilities within DBS. Work closely with the People Analytics team and HR to develop coding frameworks and metrics to analyse data and derive insights on human behaviours and motivation. Be the go-to expert for testing industrial organisation techniques in process and employee journey management Produce thought leadership in the Employee Experience and Industrial Organisation space for people and organisation management, including maintaining expertise in emerging trends in the space Requirements Bacherlor Degree with a minimum of 10 years of experience in - Consulting, Business Strategy, or User Experience; background in strategic consulting, product design planning, and market research preferred. Job_Title: AVP, AML, Suspicious Transaction Reporting Officer, Group Legal and Regulatory Compliance
Job_Descriptions: AVP, AML, Suspicious Transaction Reporting Officer, Group Legal and Regulatory Compliance OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world's most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody's. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World's Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Legal and Regulatory Compliance (GLRC) supports the Bank in all legal, regulatory and compliance matters. The division ensures that the Bank's businesses comply with policies, procedures and relevant laws, rules and regulations issued by Monetary Authority of Singapore and other local regulators. Apart from being a legal advisor on litigation, trademark filings and other legality issues where relevant, GLRC plays an important role as undertakers of the bank-wide regulatory compliance and anti-money laundering initiatives. This includes developing policies and procedures to manage and mitigate risks relating to money laundering and financing of terrorism, as well as monitoring, detection and combating of money laundering and financial crime activities. Key Responsibilities: Investigate all internal escalations on unusual transactions Conduct research through opened/closed source databases Advise business units / business compliance on STR related issues Document investigation findings File Suspicious Transaction Reports (STRs) to the relevant Authorities within stipulated timeline Participate in AML related projects Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: A good university degree with min 4 years of relevant work experience. Ideal candidate should also have background in AML/CFT investigations and financial fraud. Candidate must possess strong attention to details, research, analytical and investigation skills Proficient in writing with strong communication and interpersonal skills. Self-driven with high level of initiative and follow-through skills. Able to work independently as well as in a team. Knowledge in banking products and experience working in a financial institution on AML / KYC/ anti-fraud related projects is an advantage. At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

Use a variety of tools to be able to properly communicate and drive Advertiser’s business to success. • Perform other duties and responsibilities that may be assigned to you by the management within your category of employment in the organization and for the effective implementation, maintenance, and continual improvement of the Quality Management System. Requirements: • Candidate must possess at least an Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree in any field. • Preferably with 2 years of working experience in the related field is ideal for this position. • Strong time management skills and motivation to exceed expectations. • Business development, sales account management or consultative selling experience is a plus. • Excellent communication skills: verbal, written, listening skills. • Self-starter who can meet deadlines and enjoys working in a competitive inside sales environment, comfortable working with computers and multiple systems. Processes: • Cold calling and finding relevant contact details to reach out to unresponsive clients • Respond within the client’s requested time window • Send an email follow-up for every successful call • 6 hours of talk time per day with adherence to AUX code • Uphold Quality Assurance standards, call compliance, and code of conduct • Log accurately, record all calls • Success story (2 per month, varies by region) • Reporting as required • This sales role requires ➢ Up to 6 hours call time per day ➢ Up to 9 KPIs ➢ To ensure quality, we also have Quality Assurance and Customer Satisfaction scores as KPIs Additional Information: • Working hours will be subject to time difference based on the state of country that candidate is over-seeing (Korea Market – 8am to 5pm Singapore Time (Mondays to Fridays)) • Required to work on Singapore Public Holidays if Korea is not having Public Holidays, with this candidate will be credited an off-in-lieu (OIL). If Korea is having Public Holidays (not require working unless operation requires) and Singapore is not having Public Holiday, then candidate must utilize his/ her OIL / Annual Leave / No Pay Leave (Important to highlight to candidate) • Estimate 4 weeks training (product knowledge, soft skills, sales training etc.) • Required to pass the certification at the end of the training program to fulfil the role • This is a BPO environment where client outsource their SMB business to the company. • Information and data security is extremely important to our client. Billions of user information is in our hands and as a vendor, we are required to protect and adhere to these security requirements. Example (not limited to below) ➢ No mobile devices in workplace (locker provided to store personal belongings) ➢ No paper/pen in workplace Company Reg. No.: 201131609D | Licence No.: 11C4684 | EA Reg No: 07C5771

A very strong understanding of the dimensions and complexities of delivering full stack, cutting edge technology solution Ability to analyse complex IT issues and translate these into clear and concise communications Ability to work independently under tight deadlines and with a high degree of autonomy and initiative. Job_Title: SVP, Regional Lead ,Data Driven Marketing, Consumer Banking Group
Job_Descriptions: SVP, Regional Lead ,Data Driven Marketing, Consumer Banking Group - ( WD31281 ) Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business they were made just right for you. Responsibilities Work with CBG stakeholders to define, execute, refine customer segmentation strategy to identify unique actionable customer segments using behaviour, psychographic, needs & motivation-based information Establish governance frameworks to drive the new data driven marketing, including any capability development, adoption of capabilities, culture building, and KPI management. Provide thought leadership to guide the CBG marketing towards data driven marketing best practices, Effectively embed segmentation into day to day business management, strategic initiatives to drive unique value proposition to each individual segment. Effectively leverage existing marketing technologies, various customer engagement initiatives such as cognitive banking, financial planner, contextual marketing to bring one DBS marketing and customer experience to customers to amplify business results. Drive adoption and build new marketing technology capabilities to enable new data driven marketing use cases, scale up use cases, shorten turnaround time for use case execution across both DBS owned channels and paid channels (Google, FB etc.,) Execute use cases with each individual CBG market by enhancing customer segmentation strategy through bringing together data, qualitative studies, customer research, customer motivations/ needs info, leverage marketing technology capabilities, connecting the dots across various initiatives to amplify business results Provide consultation to business, marketing teams in their transition to data driven marketing organisation and drive impact Requirements Leadership position with cross functional experience, hands on understanding of work across data, digital marketing, segments, customer experience and business. Minimum 14 years of work experience and proven track record of executing large scale transformative projects & program management Significant experience managing senior sponsors and working team squads in a multiple-stakeholder environment, Ability to manage complex and competing priorities, conflict management and resolution skills are required, Able to drive an agenda and influence stakeholders outside of formal reporting lines is a must, A self-starter and collaborator that flourishes in a fast-paced, different work cultures across regional markets and results-driven environment, Effective communicator equally at ease with business stakeholders and technology teams In - depth understanding of marketing technology landscape and experience of leveraging data, marketing technology to drive business results Structured analytical abilities, effective communication, and presentation skills Experience of working in Financial services/Fintech or FMCG is a plus

Job_Title: SVP, Culture and Wellbeing, Group Human Resources
Job_Descriptions: SVP, Culture and Wellbeing, Group Human Resources - ( WD31811 ) About Group Human Resources At DBS, we create a supportive environment where employees can Live fulfilled - Be the Best, Be the Change and Be the Difference. In HR, we empower our people to be the best that they can be. We are critical thinkers, objective yet empathetic communicators, with a keen analytical mind. At its very core, we care, and we want our people to know that they are deeply valued. You will thrive as a trusted HR advisor to our businesses, as you strive to attract and select the right people for the right role; to provide a rewarding and supportive environment; to build the capabilities of our people to be future-ready; and to change the culture to be more entrepreneurial. As a part of our HR team, you will also have the unique opportunity to discover how we enrich the lives of 32,000 people and gain hands-on experience in our comprehensive range of HR functions. Join us as we embark on our HR New Horizon III to Shape the Future of Work, Workforce, Workplace Shape HR through Digital, Data and Horizontal Organisation Shape Employee Experiences Shape Culture by Design About Culture and Wellbeing We are purpose-driven - what we do propels DBS towards being the Best Bank for a Better World. You will play an essential role in driving organisational health and employee wellbeing through innovative programmes and practices to shape DBS culture and empower employees to be the Best, Be the Change and Be the Difference to realise DBS ambitions. We enable the organisation and employees to develop high performing teams and a future-ready workforce to drive the business strategies and bring about impactful customer outcomes. Key Accountabilities We are looking for individuals with strong track record of driving transformation at the organisation-level through people and culture. You have to be bold to try new ideas, have strategic and analytical thinking as we continuously sharpen our culture, future of work and wellbeing practices and interventions by integrating best practices / trends, leveraging on emerging HR technology and data-driven insights. We leverage Digital, Data and Science widely to deliver innovative programmes and levers to create the right culture, future-ready workforce and high-performing teams and yet we dont lose sight of our employee wellbeing Shape culture to drive organisation and workforce health Development of impactful levers and interventions to enable our leaders, managers and employees to demonstrate the desired behaviours Alignment of all new/ existing people practices to embed our culture Continuous deep diagnosis of the state of DBS culture Drive effective hybrid work Adapting our people practices to drive more transparency, empowerment and flexibility Embedding the culture, best practices and rituals Equipping managers and employees to co-create effective flexible work experiences (principles, tools, resources, training) Drive and manage employee wellbeing in a holistic manner to build a resilient workforce Development of wellbeing strategy, approach and interventions Structured approach to diagnose, measure and monitor Empowering employees to take charge (e.g. education, tools, adoption of flexible work arrangement, etc..) and building managers capabilities and competencies Transforming the way we work Partnering the business and HR stakeholders to drive and operationalise the Horizontal Organisation to maximise end to end customer outcomes. This includes alignment of key people practices to formalise collaboration and joint accountability

Job_Title: Investment Banking, Classic, SEA Advisory Team, Analyst/ Associate, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Investment Banking, Classic, SEA Advisory Team, Analyst/ Associate, Singapore The Investment Banking Division Classic Coverage Team is looking for an Associate to be based in Singapore. Our Associates play an important role in developing and strengthening our client relationships, participating on our advisory teams and in structuring and executing a full range of financial transactions. Their responsibilities include creating and analyzing financial models, organizing and preparing client presentations, helping manage transaction processes, and assisting in structuring transactions. They will gain exposure to the firm's businesses and expand their knowledge of the investment banking industry, as they develop key analytical, communications and marketing skills. They organize and prepare presentations, which explain industry trends, assess clients' situations to provide the necessary financial advice, and recommend strategies to meet client goals. From maintaining client communication to helping Goldman Sachs structure client transactions, our Analysts/ Associates are a vital part of Goldman Sachs' banking team's investments. Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree from top Business schools in a financial discipline. Minimum 2 years relevant experience from investment banking or equivalent experience. Experience working within IBD Excellent in English and fluency in another Southeast Asian language will be looked upon favorably to cover ASEAN clients, but not a necessity History of outstanding academic and professional achievement. Strong team orientation and a demonstrated ability to work effectively with team members in multiple groups and regions.

Control Room Surveillance Analyst Control Room Surveillance Analyst Singapore As a Barclays Control Room Surveillance Analyst you will be joining our Global Surveillance function within Compliance Services. Reporting into the Head of Market Surveillance (APAC) you will support the business by providing the capabilities to execute Global Markets Surveillance and Transaction Monitoring (TM) Programmes that enables Barclays to maintain, enhance and govern Surveillance & Transaction Monitoring capabilities across all business lines and ensuring t its regulatory obligation are met. Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity - helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted. What will you be doing? Conducting analysis of surveillance alerts for APAC, with primary focus on control room surveillance across different asset classes Providing coverage across other types of surveillance, such as e-communications and trade surveillance when required Identifying and escalating potential breaches of regulatory rules Liaising with the wider surveillance teams and other stakeholders for conducting UAT of surveillance models Performing periodic reporting and providing outcomes to the business Providing input into or measure, as appropriate, conformance, assurance, and reviews from the perspective of Surveillance, such as verification checks or assurance reviews You will be able to lead and support complex change across multiple workstreams and business areas What we're looking for: Previous understanding of Market Surveillance and Systems, e.g. SMARTS/Actimize Knowledge of the Regulatory environment and Risk Management with exposure to Compliance matters Ability to quickly understand and interchange with a variety of other product and technical areas Proven Surveillance or Compliance experience in a financial services environment or Regulator Skills that will help you in the role: Ability to multi-task and manage projects while completing daily tasks and responsibilities Familiarity with products across different asset classes, with primary experience in equities and fixed income An understand risk management and control functions Prior understanding/experience within banking and financial services would be advantageous Where will you be working? Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a "city in a garden". Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco.

Description You will be a member of the Commercial Lending Management Unit. This team is part of the Citi Commercial Bank which specializes in providing trade finance, working capital finance and treasury solutions for Emerging Corporate and Mid Corporate clients in Singapore. Key functions include: As a member of the Citi Commercial Bank Commercial Lending Management Unit, you will be responsible for underwriting and assessing credit propositions and transactions submitted by Relationship Managers to ensure compliance with the bank's credit policies and procedures, risk acceptance criteria and regulatory requirements. You will also be responsible for managing the credit quality of a portfolio of clients. With the portfolio assigned, you will be performing ongoing credit risk monitoring to identify any clients with potential concerns. Periodic stress tests on the portfolio will have to be undertaken to identify accounts which warrant closer monitoring and possible loan loss reserves to the bank. During the course of managing the credit portfolio, you will participate in client calls with the Relationship Managers and Sales Head. Other duties include the monitoring and follow-up of past due credit obligations, overdraft and facility limit excesses, tracking and monitoring of facility covenants, credit and collateral data maintenance. Qualifications You should preferably be a degree holder with minimally 3 years of relevant credit, risk or accounting experience; seasoned Relationship Managers with credit experience can be considered for the role You should also possess strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills and be familiar with MS software applications such as Word, Excel, etc. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential Other important qualities include ability to work independently and in a team, accountability and a positive work attitude

Teradata Developer Job Description: Must have 3-7 years of experience in Teradata FSLDM. Hands on in Teradata industry data model - FSLDM is must. Good working knowledge in Teradata BKEY, BMAP, GCFR standards & components. Experience in ETL, cleansing, customization, reformatting, integration, and insertion into a data warehouse. Ability to clearly communicate complex technical ideas, regardless of the technical capacity of the audience. Strong inter-personal skills and ability to work as part of a team. Ability to quickly learn and adapt modeling methods from case studies or other proven approaches. Must have worked in Teradata 12.0 or greater environments. Very good knowledge of Advanced Teradata concepts like Join strategy, Index choice, Performance Optimization, Compression, etc. Experience in Teradata utilities BTEQ, MLOAD, FLOAD, Exposure to query tuning. Good understanding of ETL methodology and Testing Strong understanding to concepts of SDLC methodologies like Waterfall & Agile .

Job_Descriptions: VP / AVP, Full Stack Development Lead, Middle Office Technology, Technology & Operations - ( WD31725 ) Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. Experience in front-end development such as HTML, CSS, Javascript/Typescript and web components or Angular or React. Experience in microservice development with Pivotal Cloud Foundry will be a plus Familiarity in Atlassian products such as JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket Server will be a plus Experience in database technology such as MariaDB database, in-memory database (H2) etc

About the company: Crypto.com (CDC) was founded in 2016 on a simple belief: it's a basic human right for everyone to control their money, data and identity. With over 10 million users on its platform today, Crypto.com provides a powerful alternative to traditional financial services, turning its vision of "cryptocurrency in every wallet" into reality, one customer at a time. Crypto.com is built on a solid foundation of security, privacy and compliance and is the first cryptocurrency company in the world to have CCSS Level 3, ISO27001:2013, ISO 27701:2019, PCI:DSS 3.2.1, Level 1 compliance, and NIST CSF and PF Tier 4 maturity. Crypto.com is headquartered in Singapore with a 3,000+ strong global team. For more information, please visit www.crypto.com. About the Role We are looking to recruit a Finance Manager to support Crypto.com growing business in Singapore. The overall finance team is currently going through an exciting phase of transformation to support Crypto.com's high growth plans. The Finance Manager will be responsible to take ownership of all financial related matters, including the daily, month end tasks/year end close processes, as well be the primary point of contact to the business in South East Asia. This role offers the successful candidate a fantastic opportunity to help build the finance team by focusing on efficient and effective coordination, governance and execution of accurate financial reporting and providing key insights to the business while driving continuous process improvements. Main Requirements and Responsibilities Prepare and file financial statements, GST/VAT and tax returns; ensure all statutory reporting compliance requirements are met for Singapore and/or other APAC entities in a timely manner Co-ordinate with global finance team to complete month end process ensuring all journals are correctly processed, results are validated and accurate in a timely manner Distil complex financial data with clear and practical insight for business leaders and executives Be an effective finance business partner and the primary point of contact to key team members in the APAC business Strengthen internal control framework and finance process efficiencies and make recommendation to drive continuous operational excellence Support strategic financial analysis, including KPI benchmarking across various products line Liaise with external auditors, tax agents, banking partners, corporate secretary to ensure full statutory compliance Strong interaction and collaboration with global finance teams to ensure consistency in approach, tools and methodology Work with manager and finance teams to roll out new processes, initiatives, policies service enhancements Contribute towards other projects as required Requirements Relevant qualification/s with ACCA/CPA/CA Ideally 5+ years all rounded Finance experience with a Big 4 and/or fast paced MNC Background in a fast paced entrepreneurial or startup/technology environments coupled with crypto knowledge is highly advantageous Flexibility and ability to adapt to changing conditions and different culture Ability to craft and deliver clear, coherent, and concise messages to business leaders Detail oriented, analytical, with an ability to multitask in a high growth environment Self starter who is passionate about start-ups and the growth of digital assets Prior experience in Oracle NetSuite system is a definite advantage Benefits We offer an attractive compensation package working in a cutting-edge field of Fintech. Flat team. Work side by side with the co-founding team Huge responsibilities from Day 1. Be the owner of your own learning curve. The possibilities are limitless and depend on you You get to work in a very dynamic environment and be part of an international team You will get to have involvement in developing a brand new product from scratch alongside with a talented team

Partner with IT team members and the client community to deliver IT services that utilize underlying technology solutions in support of business objectives to improve productivity. Activities include analysis, interpretation, indetifying trends and taking corrective actions. Responsibilities will primarily baseline IT process review and support, reporting and analysis duties and include leading and participation on project teams. This would include the ongoing maintenance, optimization, 3rd-level support and basic technology consulting. Accountability for the supported services within IT Marketing & Sales. TASKS & RESPONSIBILITIES Service & Solution Development Responsible for design, technical architecture and implementation following the defined BI process framework of complex systems and software in the own area including interfaces to other areas. System,Service and Solution Support Responsible to provide maintenance, optimization, innovation and 3rd level support for implemented and/or assigned solutions. Troubleshooting system problems that have been escalated. Is taking over SystemLead (and/or SoftwareLead) responsibilities for complex systems. Project Activities Support goals by participating on or leadig project teams. Deliver on assigned tasks and action items. Takes over Project Manager responsibilities for mid size and/or important projects. Technical/Organizational Focus Serve as an expert for existing systems or solutions on technical level and selected organizational aspects /e.g. processes, BI framework,...)in assigned area. Employ comprehensive knowledge to influence technologies and solution decisions. Identify IT or Pharma industry processes or technologies that could provide BI with a competitive advantage. Documentation and BI Framework Understand the BI framework and follow defined processes. Determine documentation requirements and produce documentation as required in support of baseline and project activities. REQUIREMENTS Minimum 5 - 8 years of experience in the related IT field (including 2 years experience in project management) Outcome/Results Balancing priorities of multiple tasks to ensure timely delivery on business commitments Internal Accountability Responsible for identifying and requesting resources to complete assigned tasks Internal Accountability Responsible for completing tasks, assignments and priorities in a timely manner Strategic vs. Operational Must adapt to rapid changes in the technological or process landscape and learn its impact on the business People Ability to work independently as well as be a team player Requires knowledge of commercial and medical affairs business/processes in Australia, Singapore and South East Asian countries Requires implementation skills of global projects and systems, including with key vendors such as Veeva Requires technological understanding of SFDC and VeevaCRM.

Job_Title: Assistant Vice President - Distribution Manager, Documentation - Commercial Banking
Job_Descriptions: Assistant Vice President - Distribution Manager, Documentation - Commercial Banking Some careers have more impact than others. If you’re looking for a career where you can make a real impression, join HSBC and discover how valued you’ll be. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further. Global Trade and Receivables Finance comprises over 4,500 people across more than 60 countries, helping suppliers and buyers with their export and import finance needs. Trade is where HSBC began in 1865, when we financed commerce between Europe, North America and Asia. We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as an Assistant Vice President - Distribution Manager, Documentation. Principal Responsibilities Engaging with external parties on the negotiation of Risk Participation agreements and Non-Disclosure agreements Preparation of Transactional Offers for distributed transactions to Investors Collaboration with Internal stakeholders (Legal, Rel Mgrs, Bus Dev. Mgrs and GTRS Services) for execution of transactions Contribute to the implementation of new Distribution systems and processes Administration of Team Share point Requirements Minimum Bachelor’s degree / Graduation or as required for the role, whichever is higher Background in dealing with negotiation of Risk Distribution agreements a distinct advantage Understand various industry standard agreements Ability to effectively review and negotiate Distribution agreement Should be able to work independently Understanding of GTRF products (Core Trade and Open account) will be an advantage Intermediate level experience of Microsoft applications i.e Excel PowerPoint To be considered for this role, the relevant rights to work in Singapore is required. You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC. www.hsbc.com/careers HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website. Issued by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited.

Job_Title: Citi Private Bank Associate - ACMO Regulatory Ops - [22422099]
Job_Descriptions: Operations and Technology delivers top of line products and services to our customers across every product line that the bank offers. Operations & Technology plays a central role in driving value for Citi and its clients. It provides the foundation that enables Citi to achieve its day-to-day operational and its long-term growth goals. Responsibilities: Handling various regulatory reporting/reconciliation functions for MAS, HKMA, CFTC, SEC. Handling new changes/initiatives from regulators and working with internal/external stakeholders across CPB and ICG to assess impact and facilitating implementation. Participate in the automation and standardization initiatives assigned. Ensuring smooth and error free delivery of the projects/ work assignments as per the project objectives. Ensure compliance with regulatory guidelines and assist in regulatory and financial inspections. Understanding rules, regulations and policies across Citi and how these are interconnected and aggregated Building knowledge of different markets, products, strategies and associated issues/risks Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: Awareness of recent regulatory changes and initiatives Ability to work efficiently within team environments and as an individual contributor Strong communication skills (both written & verbal) at all organizational levels Education: Bachelor's/University degree or equivalent experience 5 years of experience with managing regulatory changes.

This will be achieved by support our hiring community through our selection, assessment and offer processes, empower colleagues to plan and manage their careers. Reporting to the Regional Head of Programmatic Recruitment, you will be responsible for driving APAC candidate acquisition activity for Corporate & Investment Banking (CIB). Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity - helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted. What will you be doing? Driving APAC CIB candidate acquisition activity for all Programmatic channels; including Interns, Graduate and Apprentices as it relates to our events and assessment strategies Partnering with the business and working in conjunction with Programmatic Planning teams Agreeing and attending a calendar of events associated with attraction to all Programmatic channels including campus, recruitment events and school events Developing, implementing attraction and assessment efforts that are in line with both firm goals and individual pathway goals Educating stakeholders on our recruitment strategy, value proposition, and engage them in our efforts Designing an impactful and integrated candidate attraction strategy based on data analysis and a deep knowledge of universities/organizations Evaluating Return on Investment (ROI) on events and use information to inform future decisions/recommendations Designing and executing assessment processes that will achieve firm goals while allowing for all Programmatic channels to effectively source for individualized programming What we're looking for: Japanese speaking is preferred as the role requires interaction with Japanese stakeholders Strong stakeholder management skills with the ability to interact across all levels, with both internal and external stakeholders Creative thinker with an ability to continuously evaluate and improve candidate outreach and assessment processes Ability to consolidate and synthesize information across business lines to effectively and consistently communicate the regional acquisition efforts Skills that will help you in the role: Effective people management skills, and able to coach and drive a team Preferable knowledge of regional end to end recruitment processes Strong MS Office Packages including both PowerPoint and Excel Strategically able to shape a compelling narrative and plan for recruiting candidates Where will you be working? Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a "city in a garden". Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you're just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.

Additional Skills Excellent customer interfacing skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong attention to detail and outstanding analytical and Problem-solving skills.

High standards, continuously raising the bar, delivering with a sense of urgency; operating with a strong customer relationship and satisfaction approach. A demonstrated track record as an effective networker and closer. A self-starter who can act as a strong individual contributor, operating effectively in a matrixed organization.

You are a deeply empathetic technologist who is excited about changing language learning to make a lasting impact on the learners of tomorrow. The Role The Learning Product Manager (Curriculum) is responsible to create a product strategy for a course portfolio, lead product’s development and delivery, and bridge the communication between internal/external stakeholders. You will have a deep understanding of the Singapore EdTech market, MOE curriculum and customer need to present our products in ways that will strengthen our brand and boost sales. About Us Established in 2017, LingoAce is a Singapore-based global education technology company and leading Mandarin Chinese language learning platform, offering an immersive language learning experience tailored to meet the needs of learners aged three to 15 years old, across a range of language proficiency levels and diverse cultural backgrounds. A committed partner to both young learners and their parents, LingoAce harnesses the capabilities of passionate teachers along with research-backed digital content, featuring animation, gamification and AI, to effectively deliver authentic and interactive online Chinese language lessons. With a team of more than 1,300 LingoAcers, 4,000 certified teachers currently, and offices in the U.S., Southeast Asia and China, LingoAce serves students across 100 countries and regions. We have also recently closed our Series C and B funding rounds, with a total of $180 million raised to date. Some of our great partners and backers include: Sequoia Capital India, Owl Ventures, Tiger Global, Shunwei Capital, SWC Global & Decent Capital. Responsibilities Understand changing consumer needs and business opportunities in Singapore’s education curriculum and innovations in EdTech Develop strong working relationships with product curriculum, regional product operations and in-country commercial teams to ensure tough decisions, issue escalation, and change/enhancement requests are managed well Manage a portfolio of courses, which includes tasks such as: Develop and continually refine product vision and roadmaps for a course portfolio based on our strategy and investment priorities Ensure all stakeholder voices are heard and clear priorities are set for development teams Clearly communicate product business cases to the team and stakeholders, articulating both the product’s value proposition as well as defining and measuring metrics for its success Support preparation for releases by coordinating the activities of multiple teams and ensuring customers and other stakeholders are informed in a timely manner Support all quality management efforts by assuring that the courses and curriculum are routinely reviewed, and customer satisfaction is high Work with our research teams to define, measure, and improve the efficacy of our courses Requirements: 5-10 years of relevant working experiences in product management & operations and/or education curriculum design Experience in a high-pressure, fast-paced start-up/high growth environment Fluency in English and Chinese Exceptional soft skills – especially in both written and oral communication, to share ideas with personnel from various seniority levels Analytical mind, strong quantitative skills and a creative thinker A passion for creating the future of education and EdTech In addition, the ideal candidate as a plus will have: Background and experiences in the education field and/or EdTech space Bachelor’s degree or above of Chinese Studies, South East Asia Studies, Linguistics or Education, MBA is a plus

Job_Title: Global Tax Standards Subject Matter Expert
Job_Descriptions: Global Tax Standards Subject Matter Expert The Global Tax Standard team is a dynamic team of Business Analysts and Software Developers. We follow an agile process, working closely together as a team but also interacting with other related teams and clients to develop new product features and maintain existing ones in live use. The team is the owner of functionality around Withholding Taxes, US QI and FATCA Reporting, Automatic Exchange of Information (CRS), Generic Tax Statements for offshore clients (including capital gain calculation), Swiss Taxes and other highly flexible Tax Reporting Tools used by our clients. Your mission as member of this global team will be to Analyze, design, and parameterize the functionalities to implement business solutions for Global Tax topics (hands-on on software based Avaloq Core System) Manage the daily BAU queries, fix the defects and support the Users for Global Tax Reporting. Manage and implement Avaloq Banking System upgrades and new-feature development. Support global and local projects implementing changes on the team's functionalities This job represents a unique opportunity to advance your problem solving and technical skills, while also to acquiring banking know how on a top level. You are encouraged to acquire more detailed and interdisciplinary knowledge about other areas in our banking system, becoming an expert of our core banking software and the corresponding business processes in the industry. Degree qualifications, preferably in IT / Computer Science related disciplines At least 5 years of relevant experience, preferably in the IT / Financial Services industry Experience in the business aspects of Global Taxation like CRS , FATCA & US QI Reporting, WHT Knowledge of Developer tools (ICE, SQL Developer) Knowledge of the Avaloq Object Modelling and Parameterization concepts (Rule tables, Report writer, Order Validations, Base Parameters) are a very strong advantage Excellent analytical and technical skills Team oriented and good communication skills to closely collaborate with customers and colleagues globally. Cultural awareness and experience in working in Singapore / Asia and openness to work in a global team with members around the globe

Job_Title: NEXT Digital Consulting - Senior Digital Consultant (Smart Spaces)
Job_Descriptions: See job description for details NCS is a leading technology services firm with presence in Asia Pacific and partners with governments and enterprises to advance communities through technology. Combining the experience and expertise of its 10,000-strong team across 49 specialisations, NCS provides differentiated and end-to-end technology services to clients with its NEXT capabilities of digital, cloud, platforms as well as core offerings in application, infrastructure, engineering and cyber security. NCS also believes in building a strong partner eco-system with leading technology players, research institutions and start-ups to support open innovation and co-creation. For more information, visit ncs.co. Unprecedented adoption of new digital technologies such as mobility, analytics, cloud and internet of things, has sparked off changes across many aspects of human life and industries. These are further bolstered by advancements in complementary technologies such as augmented/ virtual reality, cognitive systems and robotics. But technology is not an end in itself, rather just a way to improve the operations and achieve business value. It is our job in consulting to make the necessary connection between business and IT. In other words, to answer the question "how is this technology helping the users do their best work?". To do this the consultant will need to bridge business requirements to digital technologies and IT requirements, through digital consulting services (from pre-sales to delivery). Specifically, in the area of smart spaces: to achieve the outcomes of sustainability of physical assets (e.g. buildings, infrastructure), productivity of workers and seamless physical-digital experiences of space occupants (e.g. visitors, workers, operators). The Senior Digital Consultant will participate in the delivery of digital transformation consulting projects, as part of a team or working independently. Planning, collaborating across various business units and internal teams, as well as client and partners. Conducting market landscape and stakeholder analysis to develop point-of-views. Supporting pre-sales activities, including proposal and presentation preparations and client engagement work. Applying appropriate frameworks, methodologies such as Design Thinking and Lean principles in workshop facilitation, to elicit understanding of problems and to drive innovation and transformation. Developing business concepts and identifying digital technologies to enable and transform business operations. Assessing impact of change and building digital roadmaps. Developing innovative business solutions and identifying digital technology solutions to address clients' needs and transform their business operations. Developing future state digital business concepts. Conducting impact assessment and to develop, a roadmap to realise the envisioned future state. In Smart Spaces: Identifying the relevant technologies required to collect, sense-make, automate, analyse, visualise, sustain and collaborate to make spaces 'smart' Developing the digital infrastructure blueprint, including IT infrastructure as well as the integration points to other services. Recommending maintenance operations models and contractual models. Additionally: Supporting the Consulting Practice Lead in new initiatives or special projects to continually develop the consulting practice or business development of NCS. The ideal candidate should have or possess: Construction or physical space design experience MEP (Mechanical, Electrical & Plumping) and IT integration design experience Building management: At least 1 cycle of building management system implementation At least 1 cycle of physical security system implementation Consulting: At least 2-year exposure in providing smart spaces consulting / advisory services to customers (e.g. from strategy development, data gathering, analysis/ synthesis, problem solving to making recommendations and helping to facilitate customer decision making). Proficient in some (if not all) of the techniques and tools in market analysis, business case and innovation such as design thinking. EXCELLENT BUSINESS ACUMEN AND ANALYSIS SKILLS, logical thinking and common sense. Being able to analyse a problem from multiple perspectives, use different perspectives to analyse a problem, know which tools or methods to apply, establish connections and relationships, identify a clear hierarchy of ideas, challenge assumptions, identify key points... EXCELLENT COMMUNICATION SKILLS (written and oral). Structure ideas clearly, create written or graphical material which is clear, structured and concise, and 100% grammatically correct. Good interpersonal skills to interact with stakeholders across all levels of an organisation, technical or business oriented Real, genuine wish to learn something new every day, to work creatively and to intelligently challenge assumptions Uncomfortable with "good enough" Self-motivated with a positive "can-do" attitude Honesty and integrity

The SAs primary function is to work collaboratively with Sales teams identifying appropriate F5 solutions to address customers business needs. They provide technical expertise and business understanding across specific or multiple industries. They champion our customers requirements and ensure they are understood across other teams within F5 such as Sales, Marketing, Product Management, and Product Development. The SA also shares knowledge and educates the solution engineering team internally and externally via whitepapers, trainings, blogs, tech-tips, presentations etc. To be effective, an SA needs to have excellent technical skills and knowledge on both F5 products and the eco-system that we work in. Fear not, we do provide training and certification to keep abreast with these critical skills! What youll do? Work on strategic opportunities within the assigned region/area of specialization and provide technical expertise Play the role of an evangelist, and thought leader in your technical specialization Collaborate with other solution architects and internal business leaders to share ideas, identify common customer pain points and trends, and identify appropriate F5 solutions Work closely with our internal product management and services teams to provide technical and business context for product launches and updates Provide mentorship as needed to the Solution Engineering community in the organization How youll do it In-depth knowledge of cloud native solutions, microservices/containers, automation, and orchestration solutions, with specific product knowledge of Volterra Evangelizing cloud native solutions, microservices/containers, and automation and orchestration solutions Speak at industry/customer events, publishing whitepapers/solution articles, blogs, tech-tips etc Applying business and technology skills with structured methodologies to deliver complex solutions to the customer both to technical and business leads Build new solution packages based on business trends/customers pain points and evangelize those solutions with the field What youll bring Experience in secure Cloud architectures in AWS, Azure, GCP or other public clouds, and multi-cloud design CI/CD experience (automate build and test pipelines with GitOps, Jenkins, etc.) Experience with cloud instrumentation and configuration management tools for deployment such as GKE, Kubernetes, Terraform, Ansible, etc. Experience with monitoring tools such as Prometheus, Datadog and Grafana Experience in software development in Go, Python, Ruby, scripting, languages Deep knowledge of F5 Solutions 8 years of related industry experience with relevant certifications, a plus BS/BA or equivalent work experience

Hiring_Company: Great Eastern Life Assurance Co Ltd
Job_Descriptions: Product Specialist - Telemarketing Job Purpose You will market personal line products to OCBC customers through outbound effort and handle inbound sales enquiries with high quality customer experience. The Job Convert leads provided by bank to sales through telemarketing; Handle customer enquiries with confidence; Correspond with customer through emails; Liaise with internal departments on policy fulfilment; Achieve sales target set out by business; Take accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks; Maintain awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and appropriate steps to mitigate the risks; and Highlight any potential concerns/risks and proactively shares best risk management practices. Our Requirements Minimum GCE 'O' Level / Diploma; Applicants with the Certificate in General Insurance/ BCP, HI & PGI preferred; Excellent interpersonal skills and bilingual; A good team player with ability to multitask and meets stringent service standards; Well organized and systematic in work; Keen to learn and positive work attitude; Proficient in Microsoft office and AS400; Meticulous in documentation and fulfillment work; High level of integrity, takes accountability of work and good attitude over teamwork; and Takes initiative to improve current state of things and adaptable to embrace new changes. About Great Eastern Established in 1908, Great Eastern places customers at the heart of everything we do. Our legacy extends beyond our products and services to our culture, which is defined by our core values and how we work. As champions of Integrity, Initiative and Involvement, our core values act as a compass, guiding and inspiring us to embrace the behaviours associated with each value, upholding our promise to our customers - to continue doing our best for them in a sustainable manner. We work collaboratively with our stakeholders to look for candidates who exhibit or have the potential to embrace our core values and associated behaviours, as these are the key traits that we expect from our employees as they develop their careers with us. We embrace inclusivity, giving all employees an equal opportunity to shine and play their role in exploring possibilities to deliver innovative insurance solutions. Since 2018, Great Eastern has been a signatory to the United Nations (UN) Principles of Sustainable Insurance. Our sustainability approach around environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations play a key role in every business decision we make. We are committed to being a sustainability-driven company to achieve a low-carbon economy by managing the environmental footprint of our operations and incorporating ESG considerations in our investment portfolios; improving people's lives by actively helping customers live healthier, better and longer; and drive responsible business practices through material ESG risk management. To all recruitment agencies: Great Eastern does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our email or our employees. We will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Please note that our career opportunities are only posted on our Career Website (http://grp.gelife.co/findacareer) and on our authorised job platforms which are specifically LinkedIn, JobStreet and eFinancialCareers. We do not initiate any unsolicited calls and all official emails from Great Eastern will be sent from email addresses ending with "@greateasternlife.com". Should you receive any communications outside from these channels listed, please do not provide any personal information and do reach out to us at GreatCareers@GreatEasternLife.com or at 6248 2990 for us to assist you and confirm the legitimacy of the content.
