Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further. Commercial Banking provides international financial services solutions that support businesses ranging from large corporates to mid-market enterprises in a variety of industry sectors all over the world. Leveraging the strength, scope and expertise of our global product network, Commercial Banking is positioned as an essential partner to large and mid-market enterprises seeking to maximise their potential internationally, offering streamlined business access to HSBC’s international network and broad range of market leading banking products and services. We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as a Business Analyst, Global Trade and Receivables Finance - Commercial Banking. Principal Responsibilities Provide support on local and regional Business Management activities, e.g. financials, balance sheet projections, reports for business or regulatory reviews, etc. Coordinate business initiatives and reviews, including onward reporting Keep track of key business activities Collate and prepare regular and ad hoc MI, business updates/presentations, and regulatory returns Support financial, analytical & reporting for Regional and SGH GTRF Provide support on various internal projects and change management initiatives to enhance efficiency and foster a smooth & well controlled operating environment Requirements Diploma or Degree in Business, Accountancy, Finance or related discipline Preferably at least 3 - 5 years of relevant experience in business management or a similar capacity Knowledge of corporate banking products, financials and business drivers i.e. P&L, Balance Sheet, Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Access and Powerpoint) Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken Ability to engage stakeholders at all levels Strong organizational skills, with ability to multi-task and cope with tight timelines Team player To be considered for this role, the relevant rights to work in Singapore is required. You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC. www.hsbc.com/careers HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website. Issued by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited.

Job_Title: Audit Manager - Rates, Currencies and Commodities - Vice President
Job_Descriptions: Audit Manager - Rates, Currencies and Commodities - Vice President The Audit Manager is an intermediate level role responsible for performing moderately complex audits and assessments of Citi's risk and control environments in coordination with the Audit team. The overall objective is to utilize in-depth subject matter expertise to ensure that the firm meets audit standards and regulations and to work with business leaders to determine solutions for emerging issues. The Audit Manager will be based in Singapore and report to the Senior Audit Manager in Singapore and focus primarily on supporting the audit coverage of the Rates, Currencies and Commodities businesses. The role will involve the risk assessment, annual planning, business monitoring and supporting the audit execution and reporting for the activities described. Responsibilities: Consistently develop, execute and deliver audit reports in a timely manner, in accordance with Internal Audit and Regulatory standards Review and approve the Business Monitoring Quarterly summary and serve as lead reviewer for all reviews Collaborate with teams across the business and determine impact on overall control environment and audit approach Manage audit activities for a component of a product line, function, or legal entity at the regional or country level Leverage a comprehensive expertise to manage a team Advise the business on change initiatives, while advancing integrated auditing concepts and technology adoption Recommend interventions to issues, propose solutions for risk and control problems, partner with Directors and Managing Directors to develop approaches for broader corporate issues Apply in-depth understanding of Internal Audit standards, policies and regulations to a specific product or function area Qualifications: 6-10 years of relevant experience Related certifications (CPA, ACA, CFA, CIA, CISA or similar) preferred Effective comprehension of business side of audit function and subject matter expertise regarding technology application Effective verbal, written and negotiation skills Effective project management skills Effective influencing and relationship management skills Demonstrated ability to remain unbiased in a diverse working environment Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications : 6-10 years of relevant experience Related certifications (CPA, ACA, CFA, CIA, CISA or similar) preferred Effective comprehension of business side of audit function and subject matter expertise regarding technology application Effective verbal, written and negotiation skills Effective project management skills Effective influencing and relationship management skills Demonstrated ability to remain unbiased in a diverse working environment Education : Bachelor's/University degree, Master's degree preferred Job Family Group: Internal Audit Job Family: Audit Time Type: Full time Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi") invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. Job_Title: Project & Data Associate, IBOR Contract Remediation
Job_Descriptions: About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities You will be a part of SC’s IBOR Transition Programme central team, working to meet regulatory requirements to transition SC’s contracts away from using the London Interbank Offered Rate (LIBOR) benchmark interest rate and other related benchmarks. This is a high profile bank project. LIBOR has been called the world’s most important number as it underpinned tens of millions of contracts globally worth more than USD 240 trillion, and will now cease to exist, with all exposures transitioning to being based upon alternative Risk Free Rates (RFRs) instead. In SC’s remediation of its LIBOR based exposures, the Contract Remediation Workstream is tasked with ensuring the amendment of all legacy contracts containing LIBOR exposure. This includes identifying and assessing LIBOR exposure document and data, and putting in place and executing upon a process including drafting and execution of amendment agreements, updating system entries and final archiving of signed documents. It is expected that the responsibilities of the Analyst role will include a mix of the those identified below, and others as required as the Programme evolves. Assist with facilitating client contract collation, review, analysis, remediation and reporting activities, particularly focused on Corporate, Commercial & Institutional Banking (CCIB) lending and derivatives contracts, working with both internal teams and an external third party provider (who is operating a managed service for the Bank to facilitate remediation steps) Assist in preparing and updating artefacts for the planning and tracking of the IBOR contract remediation process; Assist in coordinating with multiple Programme workstreams and business stakeholders in relation to the contract remediation aspects of IBOR transition; Assist in managing the process, quality assurance and related matters in relation to contract remediation; Facilitate enquiries in relation to document searches, process/system queries, and related matters; and First line of contact with Business stakeholders (Legal, Lending, FMO, FMC) and the external provider in Singapore to ensure timely resolution of contract remediation issues/escalations; In collaboration with SC system owners and Singapore technology team, assist in ensuring smooth document and data migration to and from the external provider; Support Contract Remediation workstream operations, governance and record keeping Ensuring complete, timely and well managed document retrieval and organisation for review and remediation which may include: Locating iCDMS record ID and data Preparing lists of documents by searching iCDMS and collating Maintain records of document and data provision, migration and deletion Following up on DER requests Checking completeness of document sets (e.g. that all countries and types covered off) Any manual status consolidation required in existing systems (e.g. IBOR or status data field update in iCDMS) Liaise with system product owners and technology team Validation of data and documents Investigation and resolution of process, document and data issues Sharepoint and shared folder management Preparation and maintenance of records, trackers and artefacts Data analysis, mapping and reporting using Excel Remediation status tracking assistance QC, validation and completeness checks (e.g. of checklists, document sets) Client outreach coordination between the external provider and SC (contact lists, tracked communications sent, track responses, escalate queries) Validating the mapping of contract records to trades / positions Support other Contract Remediation workstream operations, such as: Follow up on tasks allocated to business (e.g. to provide Confirmations) Support and follow up on Governance requests Attendance and operational support of Contract Remediation workstream meetings, including preparation and publication of agenda and materials, preparation of minutes and action list maintenance Support organisation, publishing and management of Contract Remediation workstream documentation and records to ensure availability and compliance with governance requirements Our Ideal Candidate Advanced level of Microsoft Office product suite use, especially Excel. Degree qualified, preferably Business or Information Technology-related Preferred to have working knowledge of the Bank’s client documentation, and related processes and systems Must have the ability to access and review documents which may otherwise have sensitivities regarding cross-border access between certain jurisdictions Strong communication skills and experience in paralegal work and documentation management Knowledge of SC Legal and Documentation set-up will be imperative for the role holder’s ability to liaise between Provider and the other members of the bank's Legal and documentation teams Understanding of contract documentation, including that for derivatives and corporate lending Understanding of ownership of the documents and where they reside Understanding of document repositories, system architectures and how documents flow through the system Attention to detail Ability to work in a cross-functional team spread across multiple geographies. Must be ready to support conference calls from teams across different time zones Experience in working on regulatory transformation initiatives is a plus The opportunity to be part of one of the Bank’s largest and most challenging Programmes, engaging with stakeholders across the entire network Be part of a multi-year initiative Build a strong base for a future career in the broader Chief Operating Officer space; the knowledge gained from this role will be invaluable in preparing the successful candidate for broader roles in the future. 3+ Years of relevant experience Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.

Job_Title: Sr. Mgr, Credit Risk Management, Unsecured
Job_Descriptions: About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities We are inviting you to build & grow your risk management career with the Consumer, Private and Business Banking(CPBB) Risk Management team. You will be responsible for developing, managing and implementing policies and procedures to drive controlled and sustainable revenue for the retail bank, together with country risk and regional analytics teams. You will be partnering with business units and broader credit departments to assess data & business partnerships, data sufficiency, and appropriate modelling approaches. You will have the opportunity to bring in innovative ideas and challenge existing practices towards improving the precision of our risk assessments on the unsecured lending portfolio. You will be part of a team which analyses and builds the financial models to predict credit risk exposures and assess growth opportunities for the bank while learning the best practices for portfolio growth and optimizing the credit risk in collaboration with markets / countries. Strategy Analyse and manage the Risk Tolerance Metrics and Management Action Triggers. Work with in-country credit risk teams to support business and to refine products by analysing target customer’s risk appetite. Formulate credit strategy as per Risk Decision Framework (RDF) in order to reflect changes in risk-return dynamics. Drive Credit Card and Personal Loan portfolio analysis and credit performance forecasts to ensure good portfolio growth. Support the formulation of High Risk Account Management (HRAM) strategy and its execution. Manage the group Credit Policy Standards and Procedures. Business Understand and analyse the credit implication of macroeconomic environment changes in which the Group operates. Processes Support Global Head of Analytics & Unsecured Lending Risk and Head of Credit Risk Management to ensure risks of processing failure are being actively controlled end-to-end. People and Talent Lead through example and build the appropriate culture and values. Work in collaboration with risk and business partners. Risk Management Track and monitor the full credit cycle performance and risk appetite metrics. Evaluate and influence to balanced business growth in the form of policy refinement and credit testing (CRD), support CRDs through analyses to formulate policy and portfolio management to improve profitability support country with portfolio deep-dive analyses and provide insights with recommendations on policy changes to improve portfolio quality. Support the development and growth into new strategic segments including Mass Market. Work with Analytics Hub for timely delivery of policy analyses and MI. Governance Responsible for assessing the effectiveness of region/ country application of group policies and governance processes. Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Lead the Group Unsecured Credit Risk Management to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank’s Conduct Principles. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Key Stakeholders Chief Risk Officers, CPBB/ Global Head of Analytics & Unsecured Lending Risk/ Global Head, Credit Cards and Personal Loans/ Country Credit Heads Our Ideal Candidate 5 years’ work experience in Financial industry and knowledge of SAS programming/SAS EM is required. 10 years of overall experience in a similar capacity. Good knowledge about Unsecured products and policy and governance framework. Strong working knowledge and understanding of risk analytics including Scorecards, Basel, Customer management & collections, Policies and Credit Initiation functions. Good problem solving skills with ability to make independent decisions and up hold their decisions despite pressure from other stakeholders. Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.

Posted by: Shena Balquin Recruiter View profile & contact Our client is a renowned local bank, and they are looking for a Technical Delivery Manager to drive the implementation/ change of the digital platform under the asset management side. The Technical Delivery Manager is responsible for the coordinated management of multiple related projects and in many cases, ongoing operations which are directed toward a common objective. Accountable for delivering Programmes on time, within budget, and within scope. This individual will lead and coordinate cross-functional, cross-departmental, cross-company teams that are responsible for all aspects of a Project or Programme, from Initiation to Closure. Overall Technical Delivery: Responsible to track the quality, scope, timeline, effort (co-related to estimation, CR’s, complexity), resources (includes GTO, business, vendor, contractor, Professional Services resources as well as operations Develop and execute the overall project plan and analyse project proposals which impacts the schedule and budget variance which in turn contribute to meeting the overall objectives of the project. Identify and schedule project deliverables, milestones and required activities and tasks. Technology Role: Work with GTO teams for the technical/Infra setup and systems connectivity (e.g. SFTP, RFTS, SSL Certificates) Work with Business unit, Information Security, Group compliance, ORM etc. on the Security Risk assessment, Outsourcing due diligence. Engage/coordinate with external vendors to conduct Vulnerability assessment and penetration testing on the digital platform. Work with Vendor, Contract Management team etc. on the Statements of Work. Track the Service Level Agreement. Stakeholder Management: Work hand in hand with Business Project Managers to manage project stakeholders and relationships - e.g. escalation, expectation, conflict, scope changes, etc. Ensure teams work in a collaborative environment Scope Management: Manage all changes to the agreed scope of work Review and assess all changes and impact to timeline and ensure all changes are approved by PSC Program and Project Governance: Prepare investment approval deck and manage approval of project by ITC/TAGC. Organize and facilitate PWC meetings. Risk and Issue Management: Manage overall project risk, track risk aging, work through escalations, change governance and related issues. Implement the risk mitigation plans Process Adherence: Partner with relevant stakeholders in ensuring that the system development methodology is followed and the relevant artefacts are delivered on time with quality, in adherence to the development methodology/approach Project Reporting: Measure, monitor and report progress to stakeholders at various levels of organization across the enterprise with the right quality, consistency in content. Implement project communication plan and review status reports prepared by project personnel and modify schedules or plans as required Requirement: At least 8 years of prior experience in Finance related projects (preferably Asset Management or Private Banking) with 3-5 years of experience in managing Digital platforms which includes web and mobile application. Demonstrated 8-10 years’ progressive management experience, including large-scale Project & Programme Management. Deep understanding of front to back development technologies (e.g. Restful APIs, React Native, etc.) Proven capability of leading teams across sites and geographies. Experience in managing vendor project implementations Project Management Professional (PMP) / PRINCE II certification is a plus.

About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities The Digital Solutions (Enterprise Technology) team is looking for API Engineer. Co-located with one of our product feature teams, you enjoy the idea of being based in Singapore. Each day, you'll be helping us understand, define, design, engineer, integrate, test, deploy and improve the best parts of our home-grown digital ecosystem to delight our human or robot consumers. You're going to help us automate fundamental components with the broader bank, using open-source technology as a bias, and integrate them with the first -class development tool chain being delivered by your colleagues as part of the bank's transformation to a fully digital-native enterprise. Most importantly you're going to work with our technology and business clients to make sure we don't disappear into an ivory tower and deliver unusable product. You don't have to know everything, but you do have to have the potential to learn anything quickly – and pragmatically you should know a lot about some (not all) of the following disciplines: Discipline Examples What does this mean? Microservice Design: OOP principles, design pattern, Rest API principles You know at least one microservice framework and know why we need microservice and the challenge of microservice Data structure: Familiar with all commonly used algorithm and container You understand what’s the different between Relational database and Non-SQL database, and when we need them. Microservice: Spring cloud or Dubbo You understand what MQ can help us and the difficulty of MQ Data Storage: Relational, non-relational and graph databases such as Oracle, PostgreSQL, Redis, Elastic search and neo4j Message Queue: Kafka, RabbitMQ, RocketMQ Java Stack Strong experience on Java, Spring, Hibernate. You have a deep understanding how JVM works, know how to diagnose, fix the OOM problems and how to tweak the JVM parameters to optimize the JVM performance. You understand Java concurrent programming, know how to use thread to increase the throughput of the program, meanwhile keep the data safe from racing condition. You understand Java annotation and know how to use it to do dynamic process and abstract common logic to decrease duplicate code. You understand how Spring and Spring boot works. Can construct a flexible, scalable and configurable service quickly from scratch. You're the kind of person that enjoys puzzles, logic problems and gains satisfaction from solving problems, likes communicating what you've discovered to your colleagues and clients, rather than encrypted acronyms, and working with your colleagues in co-located high-performance teams. You'll be excited at being at the inception of a high-performance environment, and you'll enjoy being pushed technically and organizationally to do things the right way as part of a world class brand. Job_Title: Citi TTS - Trade Asset Distribution Transactor (Vice President) - [21410164]
Job_Descriptions: Trade is part of Trade and Treasury Solutions and is one of the market leaders in providing Trade products to our corporate, PS and FI client base. An integral part of Trade’s growth strategy is our market leading ability to risk defease and distribute Trade assets. Trade Risk Distribution manages all activities related to the distribution, syndication, sell-down and insurance of risks related to "Trade" products, and the process of transferring / selling these risks, in order to achieve credit, cross-border, or balance sheet relief which is critical for the following reasons: (a) maintain a liquid asset book (b) achieve superior portfolio returns (c) manage asset levels (d) undertake large ticket transactions (e) overcome credit / cross-border / capital constraints The transactor would be an integral part of the Trade Asset Distribution team responsible for deal execution to achieve above objective on transaction and portfolio level basis Key Responsibilities: Distribution and risk defeasance of all trade asset classes: The person will be responsible for identification of the different avenues to defease risk related to a trade asset and execute the most optimal form of defeasance based on business needs Understanding of the different avenues of defeasance available including distribution, insurance, multilateral programs etc. Internal alignment with country / product / sale counterparts on what needs to be sold on specialized areas i.e Supplier & Receivable Finance FI (LCs and Loans), Export Agency Finance Fundamental ability to understand underlying Trade transaction and to communicate clearly to investors. Communicating with investors on transaction basis regarding specific transaction to be distributed Defeasance feedback / assessment: Provide up to date and timely feedback to the origination team on market pricing and appetite for trade assets. Conduct market reads for specific deals where necessary Managing "originate-to-distribute", trade structuring, clubs and syndications deals. Understand and negotiate legal documentation with counterparties (investors, insurers, multilaterals among others) Ensure that all asset sales adhere to Citi policy standard and any product programs which have been approved for use Foster a strong "one team" mentality and interact with key business stakeholders Contribute to the development of internal distribution systems such as T3 Qualifications: 6-10 years of experience Credit Risk and Trade Product experience Capital Markets Credit Risk Structuring or Credit Risk Management Experience Education: Bachelor’s/University degree, Master’s degree preferred This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

Job_Title: First VP, Decision Management Team Lead, Group Retail
Job_Descriptions: About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department Division Decision Management Solution is part of the wider Risk and Decision Management (R&DM) Division that is responsible for developing, implementing and monitoring risk and decision management models for UOB's Group Retail Bank. 'Analytics Support & Decision Management Solution' team has been set up to execute the initiatives to (1) equip R&DM team members with the right tools, e.g. analytics tool, data, infrastructure, and (2) support the enabling of analytics to the users within Group Retail segment. The Bank implemented the Decision Management Solution ('DMS'), for Singapore and regional subsidiaries (Vietnam, Indonesia, Thailand and Malaysia). The DMS Team Lead role will lead the Group DMS Team to drive and develop the rules configuration & framework, for Business as Usual (BAU) quarterly policy changes, scorecard project changes and guide Implementation Projects on DMS solution for both Singapore & subsidiaries. Job Responsibilities Role's main areas as follows: 1) Rules Deployment: Manage DMS Configuration team (functional specialists) for rules deployment (from Change Requests Analysis, execute changes (configuration), test planning & execution). 2) Rules Development & Framework: Guide DMS Configuration team to manage design & development of DMS rules framework and codes 3) Manage 'DMS change prioritization forum': As the solution supports various types of rules (e.g. business rules, credit / overlay rules, and scorecard rules), for multiple stakeholders, with different requirements and urgency. DMS team lead will facilitate deliberation among stakeholders. 4) Solution Governor of DMS solution: this role will handle administrative/ process matters (e.g. set up solution governance framework), system custodian functions and enhancements to the solution (e.g. change to the data platform, version upgrade). This requires he/she to work with vendor and IT, including project support for the DMS upgrade Y2022-Y2023. - Provide support to AS Head on development of DMS team and DMS related infrastructure framework - Manage DMS prioritization forum to deliberate on the Change Requests, Projects and issues pertaining to DMS, to drive discussion and issues resolution. - Responsible for DMS rules deployment - planning, executing, testing and monitoring. To oversee the team for design & development of DMS rules framework and codes, used for both Singapore and subsidiaries - Identify improvement areas and provide recommendations to users and Head of AS team. - DMS Governor - maintenance of DMS rules configuration ~ Establish governance process, e.g. ensuring entry / exit criteria, maker/checker & code review process are in place ~ Drive & lead 'DMS prioritization forum' (current monthly CR meeting with stakeholders o Empower functional specialists to perform analysis to facilitate the discussion / decision process & recommend proposals. Team Lead will review their analysis and findings for solution/ effective change implementation o Drive forum to prioritize Change Requests with different stakeholders o Present to stakeholders and/or senior management on the assigned topics o Oversee and coordinate DMS changes e.g. change of data model, version upgrade, release plan. o Owner of DMS Change request inventory and provide regular update /tracking. ~ Owner of DMS artefacts (e.g. Rules specification, Code release/version inventory, audit or IT documents, process inventory) - Rules deployment - manage team for development & deployment release for followings o Develop & maintain DMS configuration specification o Translate business requirements to configuration specifications through close interactions with business users and solving the business problem o Perform DMS configuration and DMS-UAT testing /support o Develop and maintain relevant documents (e.g. test scope, test plan, test scenarios, test results, and entry / exit criteria) o Provide an update to Analytics Support Head on progress and issues - Provide advisory and lead support (as 'Group role') to the regional team - Provide regular updates to Head of R&DM and senior management on key developments and issues - Lead discussions and issues resolution process including cross function projects with digital Bank (TMRW) or strategic programs in the Bank. Lead or participate to support the Credit Portfolio Management Program (CPM) for vendor evaluation, review solution design and RFP evaluation for similar rules decision engine for regional customer management module. Job Requirements - Undergraduate degree in a relevant program - Good Project management background; with experience in planning, dependencies management, risk / issues management, and stakeholder management - Experience in Rules Development & Coding with Experian solution for Credit Origination (PCSM) / Customer Management (PCCM) will be preferred. Experience in Decision Management Engine (e.g. Blaze, Triad ) is added advantage - 6 to 8 years' related experience in retail credit portfolio / policies management. Consulting and risk vendor experiences will be considered - Exposure to IT systems and implementation projects o Appreciation of the System Development Life Cycle and project management methodologies, to perform and/or develop team on business analysis, business process mapping and user requirements gathering o Able to assess upstream and downstream impact from changes - Self-starter, flexible with a proven record in people / Team management - Able to perform in a non-structured environment. - Strong interpersonal skills. Able to interact effectively with a diverse group of people, including senior management, business managers and technical people - Experience in Retail Credit underwriting, credit policy and digitalization of credit application process will be advantage - Proficiency in tools like SQL, Relational Database and experience in Credit Decision Analytical Data Management will be a plus - Experience in JAVA language or Business Rules Engine code development will be a plus, and good knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) /Artificial Intelligence (AI) driven solution for Credit Underwriting processing and Data Analytics Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Job_Descriptions: Technology Incident & Change Management, Associate | Singapore Description About this role About BlackRock: BlackRock is one of the world's preeminent asset management firms and an outstanding provider of global investment management, risk management and advisory services to institutional, intermediary and individual investors around the world. Your team: Come work with us at one of the world's top FinTech companies! The Command Center and Control team runs Incident, Problem and Change Management processes ensuring the stability of the Aladdin platform while supporting a fast pace of innovation for BlackRock and our external clients. Your role and Impact: You will be responsible for managing some of the most critically important production incidents and technologically sophisticated changes in the industry. An individual in this role will have the opportunity to build relationships with Business and Technology teams across the region and globe through exposure to financial market workflows, applications, and technologies both crafted and adopted by BlackRock. This role will put one in a position to develop the overarching knowledge of how several teams collaborate to deliver services to end users and drive business impact lead by a culture of preparedness and quality. A successful candidate will support Aladdin, seek critical business-impacting incidents and lead communication between business groups during production impacting incidents, communicate the impact of high-risk changes and releases to technology and business partners while securing approvals and consensus from the Change Advisory Board. This position is also responsible for coordinating security patching across the technology infrastructure including working early shifts or working weekends (both on a rotational basis) to support patch implementation with the mission to achieve the firm's compliance and security goals. Good interpersonal skills and attention to detail Ability to work both independently and as part of a team effort Quick learner who will learn new systems or processes, highly motivated individual who takes full ownership of responsibilities Your advantages: Knowledge of security standard methodologies, operating system patching, and CVEs Experience and knowledge of change control principles, methodologies, and tools Knowledge of cloud computing platforms like Azure, AWS, etc. and understanding of different service models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) Scripting or basic development language skills to automate common tasks We are a global but close-knit team of individuals who share a common goal of providing the very best possible level of support to our business partners and customers. From the top of the firm down, we embrace the diversity of values, identities and ideas brought by our employees. Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Michael Durkin Associate Director - Specialist in recruitment in the Finance and CFO space for Banking & FS View profile & contact Our client is a leading International Bank, who are looking for an AVP level FP&A / Performance Management candidate to join their consumer banking business, focusing specifically on the Credit Cards and Personal Loans segment. Some of the key responsibilities will include: Manage the preparation of management information reports for Credit Cards & Personal Loans to support timely and accurate assessment of financial performance including tracking against targets. Continuously provide a balanced view of business performance against agreed external & internal benchmarks to drive optimal decisions, superior performance, and appropriate rewards. Partner relevant Credit Cards & Personal Loans business heads in the development of strategy and its translation into specific operational & financial plans. Have a full understanding on cost levers for Credit Cards & Personal Loans, including cost of acquisitions, marketing campaigns costs through effective and analytical cost monitoring. Ensure costs & investments are aligned to business strategy, deliver targeted returns and that a culture of continuous productivity improvement is embedded in business processes. Provide an efficient budgeting, forecasting & reporting platform for Credit Cards & Personal Loans which delivers accurate business information in the shortest cycle time and at lowest cost, to release capacity for value creation activities. The ability to interpret the overall financial information, identify key issues based on this information and put in place appropriate controls and measures. Maintain robust process around Balance Sheet Substantiation and coordinate with relevant stakeholders for the timely resolution of overdue balances. To be eligible for this role you will require: Relevant 5 + years Financial Planning & Analysis experience in supporting business financial analysis, preferably with experience in Credit Cards and Personal Loans. Experience of managing a diverse range of stakeholders both inside and outside of finance teams. Job Description As an experienced member of our Software Engineering Group, we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. You'll be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You’ll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment—one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally. You will be working in the Commodities Technology team in Singapore. This is a global team that develops systems responsible in Athena for trading, price calculation, risk management, P& L reporting and trade booking covering majority global derivative markets and commodities products (Futures, Options, and Swap etc.). You will be part of the team who is responsible for transforming the commodities technology landscape over the next few years. Athena is J.P. Morgan's cross-market risk management and trading system that provides functionality for traders, salespeople and operations staff globally. It is used in our foreign exchange, fixed income & credit and commodities businesses. Athena includes a globally replicated object-oriented database, a powerful dependency graph and a fully integrated stack across pricing, risk and trading tools. The code is a combination of Python and C++: C++ for speed, and Python for flexibility and rapid but controlled releases. Athena is designed to provide a continuous deployment environment, and pull developers close to the business to help increase revenues, while improving operational processes and controls to reduce costs. We are seeking a technically strong and disciplined developer. The role will require an ability to attain clear understanding of Athena environment and of the unique design considerations that come into play in a diverse and highly interdependent systems environment. This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: BS/BA degree or equivalent experience Expertise in application, data, and infrastructure architecture disciplines Advanced knowledge of architecture and design across all systems Minimum 6 years of experience in one or more object oriented languages with at least 2 years in Python Knowledge of industry-wide technology trends and best practices Strong understanding of Trade management and Risk management principles in Commodities is a must Ability to work in large, collaborative teams to achieve organizational goals Passionate about building an innovative culture Understanding of software skills such as business analysis, development, maintenance, and software improvement Good communication skills and ability to collaborate with and influence other technology teams to deliver end to end solutions to the business in a constantly changing environment Eager to take ownership of work, have real business impact, overcome obstacles and take it through to completion, working as part of this team and collaborating with a much bigger community of developers sharing the technology and code base About Us J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives. We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. You'll develop solutions that help the bank provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk, and extend liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world.

Job_Descriptions: Job Purpose Be part of the Group Market Conduct family which strives to safeguard the reputation of the company, through oversight on distribution representatives' market conduct activities and ensuring enforcement actions taken are fair and appropriate. This position is for a role that sits within the Sales Compliance section with primary functions that consist of market conduct governance, executing the compliance monitoring program, and conduct sales assurance audits that includes Balanced Scorecard program. The Job Working as a team to manage, enhance and execute the entire suite of Sales Compliance programs which includes Balanced Scorecard audit. Conduct client surveys and comfortable speaking to clients with negative experiences Manage expectations and communication with business units and agency force Understand regulations related to sales compliance and apply accordingly in your day to day work Support section/department-wide programs/working groups as required which will include sales assurance audits and any other projects as required Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks. Maintains awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company. Highlights any potential concerns /risks and proactively shares best risk management practices. Our Requirements Degree holder in any discipline with 1-3 years of relevant working experience Discipline in meeting strict timeline and goal oriented Good communication skills are critical to success in this position Possession of a broad knowledge of business, products and operations of the financial services industries, and familiarity with risk and compliance processes will be an added advantage Team player, with strong accountability over personal and team deliverables Experienced candidates in Audit, Project Management or Operations looking for a career switch will be considered as well Demonstrates alignment with the organisation's core values through expected behaviours. High level of integrity, takes accountability of work and good attitude over teamwork. Takes initiative to improve current state of things and adaptable to embrace new changes. About Great Eastern Established in 1908, Great Eastern places customers at the heart of everything we do. Our legacy extends beyond our products and services to our culture, which is defined by our core values and how we work. As champions of Integrity, Initiative and Involvement, our core values act as a compass, guiding and inspiring us to embrace the behaviours associated with each value, upholding our promise to our customers - to continue doing our best for them in a sustainable manner. We work collaboratively with our stakeholders to look for candidates who exhibit or have the potential to embrace our core values and associated behaviours, as these are the key traits that we expect from our employees as they develop their careers with us. We embrace inclusivity, giving all employees an equal opportunity to shine and play their role in exploring possibilities to deliver innovative insurance solutions. Since 2018, Great Eastern has been a signatory to the United Nations (UN) Principles of Sustainable Insurance. Our sustainability approach around environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations play a key role in every business decision we make. We are committed to being a sustainability-driven company to achieve a low-carbon economy by managing the environmental footprint of our operations and incorporating ESG considerations in our investment portfolios; improving people's lives by actively helping customers live healthier, better and longer; and drive responsible business practices through material ESG risk management. To all recruitment agencies: Great Eastern does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our email or our employees. suggest improvements to increase efficiency of supply chain and profitability for the company Purchasing and Vendor / Supplier Management Ensure purchasing requests are delivered on-time, on-quality, and on-costs Implement and monitor vendor compliance programs to ensure delivery of the product Develop Key Performance Indicators within contracts to measure and manage vendor compliance Build and maintain high-quality supplier relationships Strategic Projects Support NPI developments e.g. working closely with functional teams such as production, quality management, and logistics teams, for new products to be introduced to markets Active involvement in cost-savings and operational excellence initiatives, including implementing feasible strategies to minimize waste, and a global planning system Work together with internal stakeholders to advise on supply chain operations for new offices Work with project management team on company-wide improvement projects Requirements Bachelors’ Degree in Supply Chain Management, Operations or a relevant field Minimally 8 years of relevant experience in Supply Chain with exposure to Retail / Consumer Products distribution network Critical thinker and problem-solving skills while demonstrating decision-making latitude Great interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written Seasoned in influencing and negotiating to drive process improvements to enhance and streamline process maturity Strong data analytics and competent in Microsoft Excel for planning purposes Strong hands-on experience with any ERP system, Microsoft Dynamics will be a bonus Ability to work under pressure while motivating others to meet tight deadlines

Job_Title: Head of Information Technology - dnata, Singapore - 2200004I
Job_Descriptions: Job Purpose Responsible for the management, strategy and execution of IT systems and infrastructure within the organization. Develop the IT strategy in-line with onednata Group’s overall IT strategy keeping in mind future growth and technology innovation of the group. To manage the overall relationships with business stakeholders, establishing an effective and consistent IT customer experience through identifying business needs and leading improvements and customer focus across all of IT. Ensure delivery of all IT solutions, projects and services to the assigned business units in a timely and cost effective manner. Duties and Responsibilities Establish an appropriate and cost effective IT strategy (over a 3-5 year timeframe to support the business strategy. Integrate IT strategy to the assigned business units to ensure full exploitation and alignment for the best interest of the Group. Single point of accountability for all IT related matters to the assigned business units. Develop and maintain effective working relationships with senior business managers through regular direct contact. Represent IT in the senior management team of the assigned business units. Influence senior business managers on strategic business IT investment decisions to meet their business needs within a Group perspective. Promote close collaboration and integration within the IT department. Drive a culture of customer intimacy through a business orientation framework and provide input in areas of partner and supplier management, risk management, service management, software engineering and operations, IT strategy and architecture. Introduce measures to ensure satisfaction levels are monitored and drive improvement across IT by managing a network of IT stakeholders who contribute to the IT customer experience and drive improvement action plans. Ensures satisfaction levels are communicated through IT and are part of targeted objectives Ensure delivery of the IT work programme for business units, ensuring that the projects are approved and initiated as planned and delivered within agreed cost and timescales, in accordance with IT standards and industry best practice, to meet and ideally exceed customer satisfaction. Work with applications and platform delivery to ensure business cases are reviewed to ensure that they are cost effective and that their return on investment can be realise, also to ensure projects and work programs are initiated. Drive and deliver the annual work programme and financial management of the IT budgets for the business area, ensuring it aligns with, and supports business strategy, based on customer needs. Negotiate and agree the annual work programme with senior business stakeholders, ensuring it remains in line with the overall IT Strategy and guidelines from Portfolio Management. Maintain a broad and up-to-date understanding of the business and related systems. Identify business performance focus areas to Business Solutions Design to ensure the business is supported in creating and sustaining a competitive advantage and IT becomes a proactive and innovative enabler. Constantly seek and suggest areas of improvement and innovation through more effective use of IT, ensuring value adding opportunities are presented to the business. Drive Service Management to ensure the effective delivery of all IT systems and services into the business ensuring that relevant and achievable service levels are agreed with the business. Ensure that that the performance against service level objectives is reviewed with the business and escalations are managed. Works with Service Management and Supplier/Partner management for optimisation of supplier relationship to support the business IT strategy, to deliver the services and products required and for financial planning of the business IT budget relating to Suppliers. Directing effective delivery of infrastructure and systems across networks, server platforms, storage, backup, security, applications, disaster recovery systems and end-user device management. Qualifications & Experience Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or Masters in Information Technology, Computer Science / Engineering and related qualifications Experience: 10 years of management experience of which previous experience at a senior level in IT, ideally within a customer delivery environment is required. Experience in leading delivery of business IT solutions, ideally in the travel & transportation industry is of advantage. Major account experience gained in both multinational and multi-cultural environments would be an added benefit. Knowledge/skills: Business/IS Strategy and planning Technical strategy and planning Service Delivery Management Business Change management Relationship Management Due to current travel restriction, dnata Singapore will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require sponsorship of a work visa.

Product Marketing Director Your role Are you a seasoned solution marketer? Do you enjoy using your skills and experience to drive change and increase revenue? We're looking for a customer-centric Financial Services Solutions Marketing Director for our APAC region to help develop and lead the GTM strategy and execution for IHS Markit's Financial Services portfolio of solutions, which span five key areas; 'data & analytics', 'post trade processing', 'risk, compliance and reporting', 'financial technology solutions' and 'economic & country risk'. Key responsibilities: Working with key stakeholders across the Financial Services division and marketing & communications team, and using market research, customer feedback and sales priorities, you will develop compelling and content rich value propositions by target audience which will drive the GTM strategy for marketing communications into target segments Implement, plan, develop and measure integrated global marketing programs to align with the 'Buyers Journey', including awareness, PR, inbound and outbound demand generation, pipeline building, sales acceleration and localization Help grow and implement new digital inbound marketing strategies to help drive further demand from online activity Develop global sales enablement assets and implement training strategies to instruct sales on understanding target audiences, value propositions, buyer preferences, needs, and challenges Build and maintain key relationships with multiple internal stakeholders, including: Financial Services leadership, Sales, Product Management and other worldwide and/or regional/local teams to define and implement GTM strategies with emphasis on the customer Define target Return on Marketing Investment (ROMI) and track progress against those targets Build awareness and generate qualified, sales-ready leads; partner with Sales to drive conversion of leads to pipeline opportunities and closed deals. Evolve strategic alliance partner marketing relationships to increase visibility and drive end user demand for IHS Markit data/solutions via 3rd party platforms. Provide leadership and support for the design, development and implementation of marketing programs; direct marketing activities, including marketing strategy development, planning, creative design and execution, and media buying. Help shape an effective, results- and metrics-oriented marketing organization; work with internal resources, including sales and product management organizations to develop professional marketing communications Manage timelines, budgets, resources, and staff and maintain effective communications and relationships with internal and external partners. Support executive stakeholders on corporate communications and public relations - in collaboration with the Internal Comms and Media Relations teams. Your team You will be working in the Global Marketing and Communications team and work closely with the APAC Financial Services team. Your expertise You have Proven marketing experience (ideally 10+ years) A strong solutions marketing or strategy related background. Extensive experience within the financial services industry or a financial technology related vendor or a consulting firm with financial services/technology related expertise. Prior management experience and proven leadership competencies with the ability to mobilize, motivate and inspire employees and retain talent is valuable. Digital inbound marketing skills covering a wide range of online channels You are Highly collaborative Able to achieve goals through influencing, partnering and developing productive relationships with senior leaders internally and with 3rd party partners and influencers externally. A strong leader who has experience of managing team members across global locations and time zones Flexible Working We pride ourselves on our agility and diversity, and we welcome requests to work flexibly. For most roles, flexible hours and/or an element of remote working are usually possible. Please talk to us at interview about the type of arrangement that is best for you. We will always try to be adaptable wherever we can. Return to Work Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative (link to career site page when available), we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.Inclusion and diversity are critical to the success of IHS Markit, and we actively encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected category. Posted by: Jacylnn Tan Onsite Recruitment Lead View profile & contact Business Analyst, Product Change Who we're looking for Schroders is rolling out a range of highly complex change programs across our Product division, which comprises of our global Product, Marketing & Solutions teams. Such programs include the Program Governance Change Programme (itself consisting of 3 separate projects) that is likely to continue for the next few years. The need to implement such global programs in APAC is complicated as each APAC country have their peculiar requirements in terms of legal, regulatory and business customs, sometimes very different from those of the UK. The projects and activities led by the successful individual will support Schroders aim's of becoming a top-tier asset manager by ensuring compliance with laws & regulations and where possible delivering and maintaining products more efficiently. We require an individual with an excellent track record of analysing & documenting business processes, preferably in financial services. It is expected that the individual will be able to work effectively with a broad range of SMEs as well as communicate effectively with the UK project team. The Business Analyst, Product Change will be accountable to the Chief Administrative Officer, Japan who has an additional regional role working closely with the APAC Head of Product on all Product change and project initiatives. The individual will also be accountable to the Head of Technology and Change for APAC as well as a link to the global Product Change team via the Business Transformation Lead for the Product and Solutions division. About Schroders We're a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future. We have around 4,000 people on six continents. And we've been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn't change is our commitment to helping our clients, and society, prosper. The base Singapore The team You will be part of the APAC Change team, with responsibility for projects within the APAC Product and Marketing division. You will therefore be working closely with the local Product and Marketing teams across the region. What you'll do Manage the delivery of projects and activities in relation to the roll-out of Global change programmes in the APAC region Work with the senior stakeholders to ensure clear, consistent reporting and to ensure that the deliverables of projects remain clearly focused on targeted outcome. Work with all relevant business stakeholders, including Product Development, Marketing, Legal and Compliance. Co-ordinate project committees and working group meetings as required. With the support of relevant stakeholders, create and maintain project plans with clear milestones. Support communication of progress and changes to the wider organisation Manage dependencies across the programme. Ensure programme, project and local are delivered in adherence with Group Change policies Manage effective project handovers, monitor post implementation results and feedback. The knowledge, experience and qualifications you need Experience and knowledge of Financial Services, preferably Asset Management. Proven track record as a business analyst with experience of Investment, Operational and product life cycle business processes Methodical and detail orientated. Evidence of capability to manage multiple senior stakeholders Strong collaborative skills and when appropriate influence across a broad, senior stakeholder base. Ability to deliver difficult messages where necessary and the ability to explain complex concepts in a clear and concise manner to stakeholders. Evidence of resolving challenging issues and contributing to end state solutions. Able to make trade-offs to ensure priority value items are delivered. Can drive to make decisions. The knowledge, experience and qualifications that will help Basic professional qualifications relating to the asset management industry (IOC/CFA) Relevant Programme / Project Management qualifications (PMP/PMI) Understanding and experience of both Agile and Waterfall delivery models Knowledge and experience of applying Lean business process analysis (Desired) You'll be like Inspiring and collaborative team player Friendly, approachable, enjoys working with people from a variety of backgrounds Comfortable with ambiguity and change Receptive to others' ideas and responds constructively to challenges Committed to exceeding expectations with your personal drive and quality performance. We're looking for the best, whoever they are Schroders is an equal opportunities employer. You're welcome here whatever your sex, marital status, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, religious belief or age. .

Audit Manager About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities To provide an independent assessment of the adequacy and effectiveness of internal controls and compliance of the Businesses and Functions in the country with laws, regulations and internal policies To ensure audit activities in the country are executed as required by local regulatory requirements and provide country management with assurance that local regulatory requirements as well as the expectations of the local regulator are fully met. To contribute towards country risk assessments to enable the Country Head of Audit (CHOA) to provide input to the Functional audit teams to determine their audit plans. To contribute towards an anticipatory approach to risk assessment to Group Internal Audit (GIA) by highlighting issues through good stakeholder communication in order to improve audit planning Act as liaison with Management to ensure full understanding of business strategy, plans, products, performance and risk-related issues at business unit via bottom-up continuing risk assessments and dialogues. To perform audit work as a team member / leader in accordance to Group Internal Audit's Charter, methodology, procedures and timelines. Key Roles & Responsibilities Effectiveness of and proactive contribution towards country risk assessments and audit planning. Timely execution of Country Audit Plans through managing, leading or participating in audit work. Consistently deliver high quality audit reports in a timely manner with audit issues focussed on key risks, root causes, materiality and succinct messages. Timely escalation of audit issues and past due audit issues. Exhibit effective leadership and engagement with Business, Function Heads and team members Effective engagement and good relationship with local regulators. Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. As part of GIA to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Our Ideal Candidate 5 years relevant working experience as professional auditors or business practitioners with core audit / business skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills, with ability to gain the respect from peers, senior management and business stakeholders Confident and courageous to raise concerns and issues in a proactive and professional manner Self-directed and able to work with minimum supervision, escalating issues in and appropriate and timely manner Accounting / Audit qualification is strongly preferred (including e.g. IIA, ACA, ACCA, CPA, CISA) Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Posted by: Agnes Chan Recruiter View profile & contact Our client, a NFT/Digital Assets startup, is looking for a Chief Operating Officer to join them. In this role, you will work closely with senior management to ensure that internal operations run smoothly. You will design and implement strategies, plans and procedures. You will also be responsible for scaling up operational capabilities and driving business objectives, and collaborate with the various departments in the firm. The ideal candidate should be passionate about the NFT/Digital Assets space, hands-on, and have 8-12 years of relevant experience. Relevant experience with regional or international expansion within Fintech/Financial Services would be highly advantageous.

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English Preferred Qualifications This role will be based in Singapore Please only apply if you have experience in line managing a team (including appraisals, performance reviews, hiring new team members etc) AND have not interviewed for Bare Metal / OCI data centre team in the last 9 months. The next 5-10 years will see the software industry move away from on-premise software solutions towards software delivery via cloud based services. Oracle number one strength is the size and strength of our software portfolio to which most of the business world is already addicted. Our vision is to bring this to the Cloud from our app server and development tools to our dataset and people management software. We already have the core infrastructure that all of this is built on. The future is about providing higher level services that companies can consume on demand. Oracle is now recognised as a significant hyper-scale cloud provider offering hybrid capabilities bridging the gap between on premise infrastructure and the Cloud to manage workloads in a secure, efficient and cost-effective way. Oracle plans to manoeuvre the entire company’s tech focus to provide this. Are you an experienced Data Centre Manager that has experience from racking & stacking to deployment & decommissioning – and everything in between? Interested in new challenges and being part of a newly created team working on critical projects? Then we’d like to talk to you! This shall include the day to day oversight of the assigned accounts, the coordination of services for assigned clients, the monitoring of contractual obligations for these accounts and administering debt issuance including various complex financing structures and services related to assigned corporate trust products. The CSM will also play a role with the Relationship Manager and Sales group in retentive marketing efforts for securing additional business opportunities with clients, law firms, investment bankers and other intermediaries and industry professionals. Additionally, the CSM will manage the relationships of assigned products, with the Portfolio Manager, Underwriter, Rating Agency, Accountants, Investors and Insurers) and active participation on products and services delivered. This role is responsible for addressing client issues proactively, efficiently and to the satisfaction of the client(s). Understand the administration requirements b) be aware of and continually review provisions of governing documents, amendments and supplements and market impacting items, elevate to Guarded/Default status as necessary c) perform and/or oversee all account administration activities d) manage and oversee client inquiries, resolve situations independently and smoothly as they occur, escalate promptly where appropriate e) participate in compliance reviews as required f) minimize exceptions related to: audit, compliance, client complaints, overdrafts, failed trades, un-invested balances, report quality and timeliness etc. g) monitor and minimize outstanding fee receivables for portfolio of accounts. Collaboration/Stakeholder Engagement/Oversight/Influence a) Work with Global Service Delivery and other groups within Global Client Solutions and related parties to monitor/control tickler compliance of assigned accounts b) act as senior escalation point for the deal-related client/ counter party contacts Deal-level Relationship Management and Assisting in cross-selling a) Complete accountability for all service level aspects of the assigned client relationships for the deals that are administered b) Ensure that clients receive an excellent service through regular client service review calls and client scorecards c) Assist in the bid preparation process and analysis of retentive bids with existing clients where beneficial, assist in the identification and execution of cross-sell opportunities working in close consultation with CT Sales, CT Relationship Management and BNYM Client Executives d) Develop and maintain strong working relationships with other industry participants as applicable for assigned deal portfolio - e.g. law firms, financial advisors, investment bankers, etc. Qualifications Business Expertise The business knowledge for this role requires a high level of specific product(s) expertise and client awareness. The incumbent must also be able to work effectively with clients, industry experts and regulators to translate issues and develop appropriate solutions by working collaboratively with internal stakeholders to ensure seamless client service. Strong understanding of not only the Trustee aspects of transactions, but also business and procedural aspects, as well as risk management, compliance and audit concerns. Problem Solving Incumbent must be able to solve complex client problems facing off against very large and multi-dimensional clients. Incumbent must be able to develop, implement and use different ideas and management styles in a very fast moving environment with multi-time zone challenges. Interaction / Interpersonal Skills This position could require making presentations and having the interactions to the Senior stakeholders. This role requires solid negotiation skills, business acumen, ability to have a global perspective with very large global clients, be seen as a trusted partner internally and equally important externally, strong collaboration, excellent influencer skills, ability to manage multiple priorities, and strong analytical thinking.

Job_Descriptions: CARM is a specialised AML & Sanctions Risk management team under OCBC Consumer Financial Services (CFS) Singapore business unit. The team actively works in partnership with Group Legal and Regulatory Compliance to manage CFS AML and sanctions risks in a highly demanding and fast paced environment, with opportunities and exposure in proactive AML risk management for aspiring AML expertise individuals. As part of CFS, CARM team manager must be able to provide effective risk management strategies and action plans that meet both the requirements of AML/CFT compliance, while continuing to support internal stakeholders in achieving business growth as well as top in class customer banking experiences. Reporting to the Head of CARM, the candidate will lead a team of AML analysts and senior analysts with key responsibilities covering a range of AML/CFT control and risk mitigation activities with regard to the Premier Private Banking clients (“PPC”) segment. Key Responsibilities: Carrying out enhanced due diligence checks on PPC clients including customer risk assessment and escalation to senior management for approval where required; Put in place appropriate control measures to ensure that AML/CFT risk management are embedded in the bank’s day-to-day operation. To review existing processes periodically for opportunities to improve effectiveness and efficiency; Provide AML advisory support to PPC business segment on AML related matters; Pro-active management of issues highlighted via self-identification, internal and external audit reviews Create, manage and deliver ad hoc training and risk awareness sessions on all key areas of AML risk management with PPC sales force. Participate in policy gap analysis, procedural updates and implementation to meet new requirements, Activities progress tracking through regular MIS update and risk management reporting, Support on demand risk management projects and activities, including process optimisation, RPA and AI RegTech initiatives. Qualifications Educational and Work Experiences: Diploma or Degree holders with minimum 8-10 years of direct and broad based Sanctions/AML/CFT or risk management experiences. Candidates with risk and control monitoring background and demonstrated team management experience in private banks or retail banks managing higher networth segment is highly preferred. Diploma or ACAMS certification in AML / CFT or Risk Management Technical skills: Strong technical knowledge and understanding of regulatory requirements relating to sanctions, money laundering and terrorism financing. Knowledge of regulations governing the consumer banking business and consumer banking products. Strong analytical abilities, and business & risk assessment acumen. Positive and progressive behavioural traits Good team player with strong interpersonal skills Good written and oral communication skills and ability to interact effectively with people at different levels Forward looking and embraces technology to drive efficient and effective AML risk management.
